name: App In
description: Receives input data from external applications through the application interface. Acts as an entry point for workflows triggered by external sources.

outputProps.name: outInput
outputProps.title: Input
outputProps.description: The input data received from the external application, containing payload and metadata information.

name: App Out
description: Sends output data back to external applications through the application interface. Used to return results from the workflow to the calling application.

inputProps.name: inOutput
inputProps.title: Output
inputProps.description: The data to send back to the external application. This will be the final output of the workflow execution.

name: App Push
description: Pushes data to external applications without expecting a response. Used for one-way communication to notify or send data to connected applications.

inputProps.name: inBody
inputProps.title: Data
inputProps.description: The data payload to push to the external application. Can contain any structured information to be transmitted.

name: App Request
description: Sends a request to external applications and waits for a response. Enables two-way communication with external systems with configurable timeout.

inputProps.name: inBody
inputProps.title: Request
inputProps.description: The request data to send to the external application. This payload will be transmitted and processed by the target application.

outputProps.name: outResponse
outputProps.title: Response
outputProps.description: The response data received from the external application after processing the request.

optionProps.name: optTimeout
optionProps.title: Timeout
optionProps.description: Maximum time in seconds to wait for a response from the external application. If exceeded, the request will timeout with an error.

name: App Download
description: Downloads files from the application's remote storage to the local system. Supports different storage scopes and encryption options.

inputProps.name: inRemotePath
inputProps.title: Remote File Path
inputProps.description: The absolute path for the file on the remote storage, it can be under the instance scope or current execution (run) scope.

inputProps.name: inLocalPath
inputProps.title: Local File Path
inputProps.description: The path to save the downloaded file.

optionProps.name: optScope
optionProps.title: File Scope
optionProps.description: Determines whether the file should be accessible within the 'Run Scope' or the 'Instance Scope'. The 'Run Scope' is specific to a single execution of a flow, allowing files to be accessed from the instance's history. The 'Instance Scope' is tied to a particular instance, making files available to all future executions (runs) of that instance.

optionProps.name: optDecryption
optionProps.title: Decryption
optionProps.description: Select the appropriate decryption method for your file from three available options. If the file is not encrypted, choose 'No Encryption'. For enhanced security, 'Session Encryption' employs a dynamic key generated between the application and the robot, changing with every new flow run and rendering the key inaccessible for later use. Alternatively, a permanent 'Custom AES Key' from your vault can be utilized for decryption, offering a consistent solution across sessions.

name: App Upload
description: Uploads files from the local system to the application's remote storage. Supports encryption and public URL generation for uploaded files.

inputProps.name: inPath
inputProps.title: Local File Path
inputProps.description: The path to the local file that will be uploaded.

inputProps.name: inRemotePath
inputProps.title: Remote File Path
inputProps.description: The absolute path for the file on the remote storage. If left empty, the filename from the local file path will be used, and the file will be uploaded to the root directory of the specified scope, either the run scope or the instance scope.

outputProps.name: outPublicURL
outputProps.title: Public URL
outputProps.description: Filled only if Public option is selected

optionProps.name: optScope
optionProps.title: File Scope
optionProps.description: Determines whether the file should be accessible within the 'Run Scope' or the 'Instance Scope'. The 'Run Scope' is specific to a single execution of a flow, allowing files to be accessed from the instance's history. The 'Instance Scope' is tied to a particular instance, making files available to all future executions (runs) of that instance.

optionProps.name: optEncryption
optionProps.title: Encryption
optionProps.description: Select the appropriate encryption method for your file from three available options. If the file is not encrypted, choose 'No Encryption'. For enhanced security, 'Session Encryption' employs a dynamic key generated between the application and the robot, changing with every new flow run and rendering the key inaccessible for later use. Alternatively, a permanent 'Custom AES Key' from your vault can be utilized for encryption, offering a consistent solution across sessions.

optionProps.name: optPublic
optionProps.title: Public
optionProps.description: If 'Public' is selected, a public URL will be generated. When this option is chosen, encryption cannot be performed.

name: App Log
description: Creates log entries that are associated with the current application instance and execution run. Useful for debugging and monitoring workflow execution.

inputProps.name: inLog
inputProps.title: Log
inputProps.description: The log message to record. This text will be stored with the application instance for monitoring and debugging purposes.

name: Open Browser
description: Launches a new browser instance with configurable options including browser type, proxy settings, extensions, download directories, and window modes. Returns a browser ID for use with other browser nodes.

optionProps.name: optProxyCredentials
optionProps.title: Proxy Credentials
optionProps.description: Username and password for proxy authentication. Required when Basic Authentication is selected.

optionProps.name: optUserDataDir
optionProps.title: User Data Dir
optionProps.description: If given, browser uses this directory for user data, if it is empty a temporary directory is created. Each browser session requires a unique directory and cannot share the same path.

optionProps.name: optDownloadDir
optionProps.title: Download Dir
optionProps.description: If given, browser uses this directory for downloads, if its empty uses default download directory (Chrome only)

optionProps.name: optCustomBrowserOptions
optionProps.title: Custom Browser Options
optionProps.description: Individual browser command-line arguments added dynamically. Each argument is entered in a separate field with key=value format without quotes (e.g., 'window-size=1920,1080', 'disable-images').

optionProps.name: optBrowser
optionProps.title: Browser
optionProps.description: Select the browser type to launch.

optionProps.name: optProxy
optionProps.title: Proxy Settings
optionProps.description: Configure proxy settings for the browser. Use Manual Proxy for custom proxy servers or Robomotion Proxy for built-in gateway proxy.

optionProps.name: optProxyAddr
optionProps.title: Proxy Address
optionProps.description: The proxy server address in format host:port (e.g., 192.168.1.100:8080). Required when Manual Proxy is selected.

optionProps.name: optBrowserOptions
optionProps.title: Browser Options
optionProps.description: Browser configuration object containing advanced options and settings. Example: {'window-size': '1920,1080', 'user-agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36', 'disable-images': true}

optionProps.name: optExtensions
optionProps.title: Extensions
optionProps.description: Array of Chrome extension file paths or Chrome Web Store URLs to load into the browser. Only works with Chrome browsers.

optionProps.name: optCustomExtensions
optionProps.title: Custom Extensions
optionProps.description: List of Chrome extension file paths (.crx files) or Chrome Web Store URLs to install. Enter one extension path per field.

optionProps.name: optMaximized
optionProps.title: Maximized
optionProps.description: Start the browser window in maximized mode, taking up the full screen area.

optionProps.name: optFullScreen
optionProps.title: Fullscreen
optionProps.description: Start the browser in fullscreen mode without window borders or title bars.

optionProps.name: optProxyAuth
optionProps.title: Proxy Authentication
optionProps.description: Authentication method for the proxy server. Use Basic Authentication if your proxy requires username and password.

name: Close Browser
description: Terminates a browser instance and closes all its windows and tabs. Cleans up browser resources and removes temporary directories created during browser session.

inputProps.name: inBrowserId
inputProps.title: Browser Id
inputProps.description: The unique identifier of the browser instance to close. This should be the browser ID output from the Open Browser node.

name: Open Link
description: Navigates to a specified URL in a browser. Can open in a new tab or reuse an existing tab, with options for blocking images/CSS and stealth mode for bot detection avoidance.

inputProps.name: inBrowserId
inputProps.title: Browser
inputProps.description: The browser instance identifier where the new page will be opened.

inputProps.name: inPageId
inputProps.title: Page Id
inputProps.description: Optional page identifier. If provided and 'Open in the Same Tab' is enabled, the URL will be opened in this existing page instead of creating a new tab.

inputProps.name: inUrl
inputProps.title: URL
inputProps.description: The web address to navigate to (e.g., 'https://example.com'). Protocol will be automatically added if not specified.

outputProps.name: outPageId
outputProps.title: Page Id
outputProps.description: The unique identifier of the newly opened page. Use this ID to interact with the page in subsequent browser nodes.

optionProps.name: optBlockCSS
optionProps.title: Block CSS
optionProps.description: Prevent loading of CSS stylesheets to improve page load speed. Note: this may affect page layout and appearance.

optionProps.name: optStealthMode
optionProps.title: Use Stealth Mode
optionProps.description: Enable stealth mode to make the browser less detectable as an automated browser by websites with anti-bot measures.

optionProps.name: optSameTab
optionProps.title: Open in the Same Tab
optionProps.description: If enabled and a Page Id is provided, opens the URL in the existing tab instead of creating a new tab.

optionProps.name: optTimeout
optionProps.title: Timeout
optionProps.description: Maximum time in seconds to wait for the page to load before timing out (default: 30 seconds).

optionProps.name: optBlockImages
optionProps.title: Block Images
optionProps.description: Prevent loading of images (jpg, jpeg, png, gif, svg, webp) to improve page load speed and reduce bandwidth usage.

name: Switch Window
description: Switches browser focus between different windows or tabs. Can switch to next available window or find a window by matching its title using regular expressions.

inputProps.name: inPageId
inputProps.title: Page Id
inputProps.description: The page identifier of the current browser window to switch from.

inputProps.name: inWindowName
inputProps.title: Window Title
inputProps.description: Regular expression pattern to match the window title. Use .* to match any characters or specific text to match exact titles.

optionProps.name: optNextWindow
optionProps.title: Next Window
optionProps.description: If enabled, switches to the next available window instead of searching by window title. Ignores the Window Title field when enabled.

name: Close Window
description: Closes the active browser window or tab and automatically switches focus to another available window. Useful for cleaning up tabs after completing tasks.

inputProps.name: inPageId
inputProps.title: Page Id
inputProps.description: The page identifier of the browser window to close.

name: Send Keys
description: Sends keyboard key combinations to a specific element. Supports special keys (Enter, Tab, F1-F12) and modifier keys (Ctrl, Alt, Shift) for keyboard shortcuts and navigation.

inputProps.name: inPageId
inputProps.title: Page Id
inputProps.description: The page identifier where the element to send keys to is located.

inputProps.name: inSelectorType
inputProps.title: Selector Type
inputProps.description: Choose how to locate the element: XPath uses XML path expressions, CSS uses CSS selectors.

inputProps.name: inSelector
inputProps.title: Selector
inputProps.description: The XPath or CSS selector to locate the target element on the page (e.g., '//input[@name="username"]' or '#username').

inputProps.name: inKey
inputProps.title: Key
inputProps.description: Single character to send to the element, combined with the selected modifier keys (e.g., 'a', '1', or leave empty to send only modifier keys).

name: Upload File
description: Uploads a file to a web form by interacting with file input elements. Validates file existence before upload and waits for the upload element to be available.

inputProps.name: inPageId
inputProps.title: Page Id
inputProps.description: The page identifier where the file upload element is located.

inputProps.name: inSelectorType
inputProps.title: Selector Type
inputProps.description: Choose how to locate the file input element: XPath uses XML path expressions, CSS uses CSS selectors.

inputProps.name: inSelector
inputProps.title: Selector
inputProps.description: The XPath or CSS selector to locate the file input element (e.g., '//input[@type="file"]' or 'input[type="file"]').

inputProps.name: inFilePath
inputProps.title: File Path
inputProps.description: The absolute path to the file to upload (e.g., 'C:\Documents\file.pdf' or '/home/user/documents/file.pdf').

name: Type Text
description: Types text into input fields with options for human-like typing simulation. Can clear existing text, control typing speed, and automatically press Enter after typing.

inputProps.name: inText
inputProps.title: Text
inputProps.description: The text to type into the selected element. Can be any string value including passwords, URLs, or form data.

inputProps.name: inPageId
inputProps.title: Page Id
inputProps.description: The page identifier where the text input element is located.

inputProps.name: inSelectorType
inputProps.title: Selector Type
inputProps.description: Choose how to locate the text input element: XPath uses XML path expressions, CSS uses CSS selectors.

inputProps.name: inSelector
inputProps.title: Selector
inputProps.description: The XPath or CSS selector to locate the text input element (e.g., '//input[@name="username"]' or '#username').

optionProps.name: optWaitTimeout
optionProps.title: Wait Timeout (sec)
optionProps.description: Maximum time in seconds to wait for the text input element to become available before timing out (default: 5 seconds).

optionProps.name: optKeysPerMinute
optionProps.title: Keys per Minute
optionProps.description: Typing speed when Simulate Human Typing is enabled. Lower values type slower, higher values type faster (default: 300 keys/minute).

optionProps.name: optEnter
optionProps.title: Press Enter
optionProps.description: Automatically press the Enter key after typing the text, useful for submitting forms or confirming input.

optionProps.name: optClearText
optionProps.title: Clear Before Typing
optionProps.description: Clear any existing text in the input field before typing the new text. Ensures the field contains only the new text.

optionProps.name: optSimulateHuman
optionProps.title: Simulate Human Typing
optionProps.description: Type text with realistic human-like timing and variations to avoid detection by anti-bot systems. Uses the Keys per Minute setting.

name: Move To Element
description: Moves the mouse cursor to hover over a specified element. Useful for triggering hover effects, tooltips, or dropdown menus that appear on mouse hover.

inputProps.name: inPageId
inputProps.title: Page Id
inputProps.description: The page identifier where the element to move mouse cursor to is located.

inputProps.name: inSelectorType
inputProps.title: Selector Type
inputProps.description: Choose how to locate the element: XPath uses XML path expressions, CSS uses CSS selectors.

inputProps.name: inSelector
inputProps.title: Selector
inputProps.description: The XPath or CSS selector to locate the element to move mouse cursor to (e.g., '//div[@class="menu"]' or '.menu').

optionProps.name: optWaitTimeout
optionProps.title: Wait Timeout (sec)
optionProps.description: Maximum time in seconds to wait for the element to become available for mouse movement before timing out (default: 5 seconds).

name: Alert
description: Handles browser alert dialogs, confirmation prompts, and popup messages. Can accept, dismiss, or retrieve text from JavaScript alerts and confirm dialogs.

inputProps.name: inPageId
inputProps.title: Page Id
inputProps.description: The page identifier where the alert dialog is displayed.

outputProps.name: outText
outputProps.title: Text
outputProps.description: The text content of the alert dialog when using 'Get Text' action.

optionProps.name: optAction
optionProps.title: Action
optionProps.description: Action to perform on the alert dialog: 'Confirm' accepts the alert, 'Cancel' dismisses it, 'Get Text' retrieves the alert message.

name: Save Image
description: Downloads and saves images from web pages to local disk. Supports both base64 encoded images and images from URLs, extracting from the src attribute of image elements.

inputProps.name: inPageId
inputProps.title: Page Id
inputProps.description: The page identifier where the image element is located.

inputProps.name: inSelectorType
inputProps.title: Selector Type
inputProps.description: Choose how to locate the image element: XPath uses XML path expressions, CSS uses CSS selectors.

inputProps.name: inSelector
inputProps.title: Selector
inputProps.description: The XPath or CSS selector to locate the image element to save (e.g., '//img[@alt="logo"]' or 'img.logo').

inputProps.name: inSaveFilePath
inputProps.title: Save File Path
inputProps.description: The file path where the image will be saved (e.g., 'C:\\images\\logo.png'). The file extension determines the format.

optionProps.name: optWaitTimeout
optionProps.title: Wait Timeout (sec)
optionProps.description: Maximum time in seconds to wait for the image element to become available before timing out (default: 5 seconds).

name: Click Element
description: Performs various mouse click actions on web elements. Supports single click, double click, right click, middle click, and hold/release operations for complex interactions.

inputProps.name: inPageId
inputProps.title: Page Id
inputProps.description: The page identifier where the element to click is located.

inputProps.name: inSelectorType
inputProps.title: Selector Type
inputProps.description: Choose how to locate the element: XPath uses XML path expressions, CSS uses CSS selectors.

inputProps.name: inSelector
inputProps.title: Selector
inputProps.description: The XPath or CSS selector to locate the element to click (e.g., '//button[@id="submit"]' or '#submit').

optionProps.name: optWaitTimeout
optionProps.title: Wait Timeout (sec)
optionProps.description: Maximum time in seconds to wait for the element to become clickable before timing out (default: 5 seconds).

optionProps.name: optClickType
optionProps.title: Click Type
optionProps.description: Type of mouse click to perform: Single (normal click), Double (double-click), Hold (press and hold), Release (release held click), Middle (scroll wheel click), Right (context menu click).

inputProps.name: inSelectorType
inputProps.title: Selector Type
inputProps.description: Choose how to locate the element: XPath uses XML path expressions, CSS uses CSS selectors.

inputProps.name: inSelector
inputProps.title: Selector
inputProps.description: The XPath or CSS selector to locate the element to wait for (e.g., '//div[@class="loading"]' or '.loading').

inputProps.name: inPageId
inputProps.title: Page Id
inputProps.description: The page identifier where the element to wait for is located.

optionProps.name: optCondition
optionProps.title: Condition
optionProps.description: Wait condition: 'To Appear' waits for element to become visible, 'To Disappear' waits for element to be removed, 'Appear & Disappear' waits for element to appear then disappear.

optionProps.name: optTimeout
optionProps.title: Timeout (sec)
optionProps.description: Maximum time in seconds to wait for the condition to be met before timing out and failing the node (default: 30 seconds).

inputProps.name: inPageId
inputProps.title: Page Id
inputProps.description: The page identifier where the dropdown element is located.

inputProps.name: inSelectorType
inputProps.title: Selector Type
inputProps.description: Choose how to locate the dropdown element: XPath uses XML path expressions, CSS uses CSS selectors.

inputProps.name: inSelector
inputProps.title: Selector
inputProps.description: The XPath or CSS selector to locate the dropdown element (e.g., '//select[@name="country"]' or 'select[name="country"]').

inputProps.name: inValue
inputProps.title: Value
inputProps.description: The value or text of the option to select from the dropdown. Can be the option value attribute or visible text.

inputProps.name: inPageId
inputProps.title: Page Id
inputProps.description: The page identifier from which to retrieve cookies.

outputProps.name: outCookies
outputProps.title: Cookies
outputProps.description: Array of cookie objects containing name, value, domain, path, and other cookie properties from the current page.

inputProps.name: inCookies
inputProps.title: Cookies
inputProps.description: JSON array of cookie objects to set. Each cookie should have 'name' and 'value' properties. Optional properties: 'domain', 'path', 'expires', 'maxAge', 'secure', 'httpOnly', 'sameSite'. Example: [{'name': 'sessionID', 'value': '12345', 'domain': 'example.com'}]

inputProps.name: inPageId
inputProps.title: Page Id
inputProps.description: The page identifier where the cookies will be set.

inputProps.name: inSelector
inputProps.title: Selector
inputProps.description: The XPath or CSS selector to locate the element from which to retrieve the attribute value (e.g., '//input[@name="email"]' or '#email').

inputProps.name: inAttribute
inputProps.title: Attribute
inputProps.description: The attribute name to retrieve from the element. Common attributes: 'value', 'innerText', 'innerHTML', 'href', 'src', 'alt', 'title', 'class', 'id'.

inputProps.name: inPageId
inputProps.title: Page Id
inputProps.description: The page identifier where the element to get value from is located.

inputProps.name: inSelectorType
inputProps.title: Selector Type
inputProps.description: Choose how to locate the element: XPath uses XML path expressions, CSS uses CSS selectors.

outputProps.name: outValue
outputProps.title: Value
outputProps.description: The retrieved attribute value from the selected element.

inputProps.name: inSelector
inputProps.title: Selector
inputProps.description: The XPath or CSS selector to locate the element to set the value on (e.g., '//input[@name="quantity"]' or '#quantity').

inputProps.name: inValue
inputProps.title: Value
inputProps.description: The value to set on the element. This directly sets the element's value property without simulating user typing.

inputProps.name: inPageId
inputProps.title: Page Id
inputProps.description: The page identifier where the element to set value on is located.

inputProps.name: inSelectorType
inputProps.title: Selector Type
inputProps.description: Choose how to locate the element: XPath uses XML path expressions, CSS uses CSS selectors.

inputProps.name: inPageId
inputProps.title: Page Id
inputProps.description: The page identifier containing the iframe to switch to.

inputProps.name: inRootFrame
inputProps.title: Switch To Root
inputProps.description: If enabled, switches to the main document frame (root). If disabled, switches to the frame specified by the selector.

inputProps.name: inSelector
inputProps.title: Selector
inputProps.description: The XPath or CSS selector to locate the iframe element to switch to (e.g., '//iframe[@name="content"]' or 'iframe[name="content"]').

inputProps.name: inSelectorType
inputProps.title: Selector Type
inputProps.description: Choose how to locate the iframe element: XPath uses XML path expressions, CSS uses CSS selectors.

inputProps.name: inPageId
inputProps.title: Page Id
inputProps.description: The page identifier to navigate back in its browser history.

inputProps.name: inTimes
inputProps.title: Times
inputProps.description: Number of steps to go back in the browser history (default: 1).

inputProps.name: inPageId
inputProps.title: Page Id
inputProps.description: The page identifier to navigate forward in its browser history.

inputProps.name: inTimes
inputProps.title: Times
inputProps.description: Number of steps to go forward in the browser history (default: 1).

inputProps.name: inPageId
inputProps.title: Page Id
inputProps.description: The page identifier of the browser page to refresh.

inputProps.name: inPageId
inputProps.title: Page Id
inputProps.description: The page identifier to take a screenshot of.

inputProps.name: inSaveFilePath
inputProps.title: Save File Path
inputProps.description: The file path where the screenshot will be saved (e.g., 'C:\screenshots\page.png'). Supports PNG format.

inputProps.name: inPageId
inputProps.title: Page Id
inputProps.description: The page identifier where the JavaScript code will be executed.

outputProps.name: outResult
outputProps.title: Result
outputProps.description: The return value from the executed JavaScript code, converted to string format.

optionProps.name: func
optionProps.title: Script
optionProps.description: JavaScript code to execute in the browser context. The script has access to the DOM and can return values. Use 'return' statement to output results.

inputProps.name: inSelector
inputProps.title: Selector
inputProps.description: The XPath or CSS selector to locate the table element to scrape (e.g., '//table[@id="data"]' or 'table.data-table').

inputProps.name: inSelectorType
inputProps.title: Selector Type
inputProps.description: Choose how to locate the table element: XPath uses XML path expressions, CSS uses CSS selectors.

inputProps.name: inPageId
inputProps.title: Page Id
inputProps.description: The page identifier where the table to scrape is located.

outputProps.name: outTable
outputProps.title: Table
outputProps.description: The extracted table data as a structured object with rows and columns.

optionProps.name: optVertical
optionProps.title: Vertical
optionProps.description: If enabled, treats the table as having vertical headers (first column contains headers). If disabled, treats first row as headers.

optionProps.name: optExcludedColumns
optionProps.title: Excluded Columns
optionProps.description: Array of column names or indices to exclude from the extracted table data.

optionProps.name: optCustomExcludedColumns
optionProps.title: Custom Excluded Columns
optionProps.description: List of column names to exclude from the table extraction. Enter one column name per field.

inputProps.name: inPageId
inputProps.title: Page Id
inputProps.description: The page identifier where the list element is located.

inputProps.name: inSelector
inputProps.title: Selector
inputProps.description: The XPath or CSS selector to locate the list container element on the page.

inputProps.name: inSelectorType
inputProps.title: Selector Type
inputProps.description: Choose how to locate the list element: XPath uses XML path expressions, CSS uses CSS selectors.

outputProps.name: outTable
outputProps.title: Table
outputProps.description: The extracted list data as a structured object with rows and columns based on the defined list items.

optionProps.name: optListItems
optionProps.title: List Items
optionProps.description: Array defining which data to extract from each list item. Each item should specify name, selector, and optional attribute.

name: Get From Clipboard
description: Retrieves the current text content from the system clipboard and stores it in a variable for use in the workflow.

outputProps.name: outText
outputProps.title: Clipboard Data
outputProps.description: The text content retrieved from the system clipboard. Contains whatever text is currently copied to the clipboard.

name: Set To Clipboard
description: Copies the specified text content to the system clipboard, making it available for pasting in other applications.

inputProps.name: inText
inputProps.title: Text Content
inputProps.description: The text content to copy to the system clipboard. Any data type will be converted to string format before copying.

name: Detect Intent
description: Analyzes text input to detect user intents using Google Cloud Dialogflow. Returns structured intent information including parameters and confidence scores.

inputProps.name: inText
inputProps.title: Text
inputProps.description: The input text to analyze for intent detection. Should contain natural language that expresses a user's intent or request.

outputProps.name: outIntent
outputProps.title: Intent
outputProps.description: The detected intent result object containing intent name, parameters, confidence score, and fulfillment text from Dialogflow analysis.

optionProps.name: optChannel
optionProps.title: Google
optionProps.description: The cloud provider for intent detection services. Currently supports Google Cloud Dialogflow.

optionProps.name: optProjectIdv2
optionProps.title: Dialog Flow Project ID
optionProps.description: The Google Cloud project ID where your Dialogflow agent is configured. This identifies your specific Dialogflow project.

optionProps.name: optSessionId
optionProps.title: Session Id
optionProps.description: Unique identifier for the conversation session. Maintains context across multiple requests. If empty, uses the message ID.

optionProps.name: optCredentials
optionProps.title: Credentials
optionProps.description: Google Cloud service account credentials (JSON key file) stored in your vault for accessing Dialogflow API.

optionProps.name: optLanguage
optionProps.title: Language
optionProps.description: The language code for the input text and expected responses. Must match your Dialogflow agent's training language.

name: Text Translate
description: Translates text between languages using Google Cloud Translate API. Can also detect the source language of the input text.

inputProps.name: inText
inputProps.title: Text
inputProps.description: The input text to translate. Can be in any supported language that Google Translate can detect.

outputProps.name: outText
outputProps.title: Text
outputProps.description: The translated text in the target language. If only language detection is enabled, returns the original text.

outputProps.name: outSourceLanguage
outputProps.title: Source Language
outputProps.description: The detected language code of the input text (e.g., 'en' for English, 'es' for Spanish).

outputProps.name: outTargetLanguage
outputProps.title: Target Language
outputProps.description: The target language code that was used for translation (e.g., 'en' for English, 'es' for Spanish).

optionProps.name: optChannel
optionProps.title: Google
optionProps.description: The cloud provider for translation services. Currently supports Google Cloud Translate API.

optionProps.name: optCredentials
optionProps.title: Credentials
optionProps.description: Google Cloud service account credentials (JSON key file) stored in your vault for accessing Translate API.

optionProps.name: optDetectOnly
optionProps.title: Only Detect Language
optionProps.description: If enabled, only detects the language of the input text without performing translation. Useful for language identification workflows.

optionProps.name: optTargetLanguage
optionProps.title: Target Language
optionProps.description: The language to translate the input text into. Ignored when 'Only Detect Language' is enabled.

name: Text Analyze
description: Performs advanced text analysis using Google Cloud Natural Language API. Supports sentiment analysis, entity extraction, syntax analysis, and content classification.

inputProps.name: inText
inputProps.title: Text
inputProps.description: The input text to analyze using Google Cloud Natural Language API. Can contain any natural language content for sentiment, entity, syntax, or classification analysis.

outputProps.name: outResult
outputProps.title: Analysis Result
outputProps.description: The complete analysis result object containing the requested analysis data such as sentiment scores, detected entities, syntax information, or content classifications.

optionProps.name: optAnalyzeType
optionProps.title: Action
optionProps.description: The type of text analysis to perform. Choose from sentiment analysis, entity extraction, entity sentiment, syntax analysis, or content classification.

optionProps.name: optChannel
optionProps.title: Google
optionProps.description: The cloud provider for natural language processing services. Currently supports Google Cloud Natural Language API.

optionProps.name: optCredentials
optionProps.title: Credentials
optionProps.description: Google Cloud service account credentials (JSON key file) stored in your vault for accessing Natural Language API.

name: Text To Speech
description: Converts text to speech audio files using Google Cloud Text-to-Speech API. Supports multiple languages, audio formats, and sample rates.

inputProps.name: inText
inputProps.title: Text
inputProps.description: The input text to convert to speech. Can be plain text or SSML markup for advanced voice control.

inputProps.name: inSaveFilePath
inputProps.title: Save File Path
inputProps.description: The full file path where the generated audio file will be saved. Include the desired file extension (e.g., .wav, .mp3).

outputProps.name: outPath
outputProps.title: Audio File Path
outputProps.description: The full path to the generated audio file containing the synthesized speech. This file can be played back or used in other audio operations.

optionProps.name: optCredentials
optionProps.title: Credentials
optionProps.description: Google Cloud service account credentials (JSON key file) stored in your vault for accessing Text-to-Speech API.

optionProps.name: optAudioFormat
optionProps.title: Type
optionProps.description: The audio file format for the generated speech. Choose MP3 for smaller files, WAV for highest quality, or OGG for web applications.

optionProps.name: optFrequency
optionProps.title: Sample Rate (hertz)
optionProps.description: The audio sample rate in Hz. Higher rates provide better quality but larger file sizes. Use 8000-16000 for voice calls, 22050-44100 for music quality.

optionProps.name: optLanguage
optionProps.title: Language
optionProps.description: The language and locale for speech synthesis. Determines the accent and pronunciation style of the generated voice.

optionProps.name: optChannel
optionProps.title: Google
optionProps.description: The cloud provider for text-to-speech services. Currently supports Google Cloud Text-to-Speech API.

name: Speech to Text
description: Converts audio files to text using Google Cloud Speech-to-Text API. Supports multiple languages and audio sample rates for accurate transcription.

outputProps.name: outText
outputProps.title: Text
outputProps.description: The transcribed text content from the audio file. Contains the speech-to-text conversion result.

optionProps.name: optChannel
optionProps.title: Google
optionProps.description: The cloud provider for speech-to-text services. Currently supports Google Cloud Speech-to-Text API.

optionProps.name: optCredentials
optionProps.title: Credentials
optionProps.description: Google Cloud service account credentials (JSON key file) stored in your vault for accessing Speech-to-Text API.

optionProps.name: optLanguage
optionProps.title: Language
optionProps.description: The language of the audio content to transcribe. Should match the spoken language in the audio file for best accuracy.

optionProps.name: optFrequency
optionProps.title: Sample Rate (hertz)
optionProps.description: The sample rate of the audio file in Hz. Should match the actual sample rate of your audio file for optimal transcription accuracy.

name: Read CSV
description: Reads CSV files and converts them to table format with support for different encodings, separators, and header options. Can skip rows and jsonify the output.

inputProps.name: inFilePath
inputProps.title: File Path
inputProps.description: The full path to the CSV file to read. Can be an absolute or relative path to the CSV file on the filesystem.

outputProps.name: outTable
outputProps.title: Table
outputProps.description: The parsed CSV data as a table structure. Contains rows and columns from the CSV file, optionally with headers.

optionProps.name: optSeparator
optionProps.title: Separator
optionProps.description: The field separator character used in the CSV file. Choose the separator that matches your CSV file format.

optionProps.name: optOffset
optionProps.title: Skip Rows
optionProps.description: Number of rows to skip from the beginning of the CSV file. Useful for skipping metadata or unwanted header rows.

optionProps.name: optEncoding
optionProps.title: Open with Encoding
optionProps.description: The character encoding of the CSV file. Choose the encoding that matches your file to ensure special characters are read correctly.

optionProps.name: optHeaders
optionProps.title: Headers
optionProps.description: Whether the first row of the CSV file contains column headers. If enabled, the first row will be treated as column names.

optionProps.name: optJsonify
optionProps.title: Jsonify
optionProps.description: Whether to convert the table data to JSON format. If enabled, the output will be structured as JSON objects instead of plain table format.

name: Write CSV
description: Writes table data to CSV files with configurable separators, encoding options, and header inclusion. Creates new files or overwrites existing ones.

inputProps.name: inTable
inputProps.title: Table
inputProps.description: The table data to write to the CSV file. Should be in table format with rows and optionally column headers.

inputProps.name: inFilePath
inputProps.title: File Path
inputProps.description: The full path where the CSV file will be created or overwritten. Include the .csv extension in the filename.

optionProps.name: optSeparator
optionProps.title: Separator
optionProps.description: The field separator character to use in the CSV file. Choose the separator appropriate for your target system or application.

optionProps.name: optEncoding
optionProps.title: Save with Encoding
optionProps.description: The character encoding to use when saving the CSV file. Choose UTF-8 for modern systems or specific encodings for legacy applications.

optionProps.name: optHeaders
optionProps.title: Headers
optionProps.description: Whether to include column headers as the first row in the CSV file. If enabled, column names will be written as the first row.

name: Append CSV
description: Appends table data to existing CSV files without overwriting the existing content. Supports different encodings and separator configurations.

inputProps.name: inTable
inputProps.title: Table
inputProps.description: The table data to append to the existing CSV file. New rows will be added at the end of the file.

inputProps.name: inFilePath
inputProps.title: File Path
inputProps.description: The full path to the existing CSV file where data will be appended. The file must already exist.

optionProps.name: optSeparator
optionProps.title: Separator
optionProps.description: The field separator character used in the existing CSV file. Must match the separator used in the target file.

optionProps.name: optEncoding
optionProps.title: Append with Encoding
optionProps.description: The character encoding to use when appending to the CSV file. Should match the encoding of the existing file.

name: Split CSV
description: Splits large CSV files into smaller files based on maximum row count. Preserves headers across split files and maintains original formatting.

inputProps.name: inMaxRows
inputProps.title: Max Rows
inputProps.description: The maximum number of data rows per split file. Headers are not counted towards this limit.

inputProps.name: inFilePath
inputProps.title: File Path
inputProps.description: The full path to the large CSV file that needs to be split into smaller files.

outputProps.name: outDirPath
outputProps.title: Out Directory
outputProps.description: The directory path where the split CSV files will be created. All generated files will be saved in this location.

optionProps.name: optSeparator
optionProps.title: Separator
optionProps.description: The field separator character used in the CSV file. Must match the separator used in the source file.

optionProps.name: optHeaders
optionProps.title: Headers
optionProps.description: Whether the first row contains column headers. If enabled, headers will be included in each split file.

name: Message Box
description: Displays interactive dialog boxes to users with different types (Info, Error, Yes/No). Supports custom titles and messages for user interaction.

inputProps.name: inTitle
inputProps.title: Title
inputProps.description: The title text to display in the dialog box header. This appears at the top of the dialog window.

inputProps.name: inText
inputProps.title: Text
inputProps.description: The main message content to display in the dialog box. This is the primary text that users will see.

outputProps.name: outConfirmed
outputProps.title: Confirmed
outputProps.description: Boolean result indicating whether the user confirmed the dialog. True for Yes/OK buttons, false for No/Cancel buttons.

optionProps.name: optType
optionProps.title: Type
optionProps.description: The type of dialog box to display. Determines the buttons and icon shown in the dialog.

name: Input Box
description: Displays an input dialog box to collect text input from users. Supports custom titles, prompts, and default values for user data entry.

inputProps.name: inText
inputProps.title: Text
inputProps.description: The prompt text to display in the input dialog. This tells the user what information to enter.

inputProps.name: inTitle
inputProps.title: Title
inputProps.description: The title text to display in the input dialog header. This appears at the top of the dialog window.

outputProps.name: outText
outputProps.title: Text
outputProps.description: The text entered by the user in the input dialog. Contains the user's input response.

optionProps.name: optDefault
optionProps.title: Default Value
optionProps.description: The default text to pre-populate in the input field. Users can modify or accept this value.

name: Open Excel
description: Opens an Excel file (.xlsx, .xlsm, .xls) for manipulation. Supports password-protected files through the credential system.

inputProps.name: inPath
inputProps.title: Excel File Path
inputProps.description: The path to the Excel file to open. Supports .xlsx, .xlsm, .xls, .xlam, .xltm, and .xltx formats. If the file doesn't exist and 'Create If Not Exists' is enabled, a new file will be created.

optionProps.name: optCreate
optionProps.title: Create If Not Exists
optionProps.description: If true, creates a new Excel file if the specified path doesn't exist. If false, returns an error when the file is not found.

optionProps.name: optCredentials
optionProps.title: Password
optionProps.description: Credentials for password-protected Excel files. Select a vault item containing the file password to open encrypted files.

name: Close Excel
description: Closes an opened Excel file and releases its file handle from memory. This should be called when you're done working with a file.

name: Create Excel
description: Creates a new Excel file at the specified path. Can optionally overwrite existing files if the Overwrite option is enabled.

optionProps.name: optOverwrite
optionProps.title: Overwrite If Exists
optionProps.description: If true, overwrites an existing file at the specified path. If false, returns an error when a file already exists at the target location.

name: Save Excel
description: Saves an Excel file to disk. Can save to the original path or to a new location specified by the Save File Path parameter.

inputProps.name: inSaveFilePath
inputProps.title: Save File Path
inputProps.description: Optional path to save the file to a different location. If empty, saves to the original file path.

name: Switch To Sheet
description: Switches the active worksheet in an Excel file to the specified sheet name. The active sheet determines which sheet other operations will target.

inputProps.name: inSheet
inputProps.title: Sheet
inputProps.description: The name of the worksheet to switch to. This sheet must exist in the Excel file.

inputProps.name: inFileDescriptor
inputProps.title: Excel File Descriptor
inputProps.description: The Excel file handle returned from Open Excel or Create Excel node.

name: Create Sheet
description: Creates a new worksheet in an Excel file with the specified name. Optionally switches to the new sheet after creation.

name: Copy Sheet
description: Creates a copy of an existing worksheet within the same Excel file. The copied sheet includes all data, formatting, and formulas from the source sheet.

name: Set Style
description: Applies formatting styles to a range of cells in the active worksheet. Supports font family, size, formatting options like bold/italic/underline, and custom number formats.

name: Set Active Cell
description: Sets the active cell position in the worksheet. Can move to a specific cell or navigate relative to the current position (up, down, next, previous, etc.).

name: Set Cell Value
description: Sets the value of a specific cell in the active worksheet. Supports different data formats including text, numbers, dates, and boolean values.

name: Get Cell Value
description: Retrieves the value from a specific cell in the active worksheet. Can return formatted or raw cell values, and supports formula evaluation.

optionProps.name: optRawValue
optionProps.title: Raw Value
optionProps.description: Enable this option if you wish to retrieve the unformatted raw cell value. For example, it will return the float value 1234.50 instead of the formatted string '$1,234.50'. For date cells, it will return the raw numeric value 45167 (the number of days passed since 01-01-1900) instead of the Date Time formatted '2023-08-30' string value.

name: Set Formula
description: Sets an Excel formula in a specific cell. Supports all Excel formula syntax including functions, cell references, and mathematical operations.

name: Delete Cell
description: Clears the content of a specific cell in the active worksheet. Can target the active cell or a specific cell reference.

name: Insert Column
description: Inserts a new column with data into the worksheet. Can insert at the active column position or at a specific column location.

name: Insert Row
description: Inserts a new row with data into the worksheet. Can insert at the active row position or at a specific row number.

name: Delete Row
description: Deletes an entire row from the worksheet. Can delete the active row or a specific row by number.

name: Get Range
description: Retrieves data from a specified cell range in the active worksheet. Can return data in table format with optional headers and JSON conversion.

optionProps.name: optRawValue
optionProps.title: Raw Value
optionProps.description: Enable this option if you wish to sort columns by their raw cell values. When selected, 'Get Range' will return unformatted values. For example, it will return the float value 1234.50 instead of the formatted string '$1,234.50', or the raw numeric value 45167 (the number of days passed since 01-01-1900) instead of the Date Time formatted '2023-08-30' string value.

name: Delete Column
description: Deletes an entire column from the worksheet. Can delete the active column or a specific column by name/letter.

name: Get Row
description: Retrieves data from a specific row in the worksheet. Supports navigation options like first row, next row, previous row, or specific row number.

name: Get Column
description: Retrieves all data from a specific column in the worksheet. Returns the column values as an array.

name: Set Range
description: Writes table data to a specified cell range in the worksheet. Can start from the active cell or a specific starting cell position.

name: Excel to CSV
description: Converts an Excel file to CSV format. Each worksheet is converted to a separate CSV file with configurable field separators.

name: Get Sheets
description: Retrieves a list of all worksheet names in the Excel file. Optionally includes metadata information about each sheet.

name: Append Excel
description: Appends data from one Excel worksheet to another Excel worksheet. Combines data from two different sheets or files.

name: Merge Excel
description: Merges data from two Excel worksheets into a single dataset. Combines data from two different sheets or files side by side.

name: Find and Replace
description: Searches for specific text or values in the worksheet and replaces them with new content. Supports regex patterns and different data formats.

name: Search Sheet
description: Searches for specific text or patterns in the worksheet and returns the cell locations where matches are found. Supports regex pattern matching.

name: Clear Range
description: Clears content from a specified cell range in the worksheet. Removes all data while preserving cell formatting.

name: Create Pivot Table
description: Creates a pivot table from source data to summarize and analyze information. Supports rows, columns, filters, and data aggregation options.

name: Get Formula
description: Retrieves the formula from a specific cell in the worksheet. Returns the actual formula text rather than the calculated result.

name: List Directory
description: Lists files and directories in the specified path with filtering and sorting options.

inputProps.name: inDirPath
inputProps.title: Directory Path
inputProps.description: The root directory path from which to start building the tree structure. All subdirectories will be recursively scanned.

inputProps.name: inNameFilter
inputProps.title: Name Filter (Regex)
inputProps.description: Regular expression pattern to filter files and directories by name. Only items matching the pattern will be included in the results.

outputProps.name: outFiles
outputProps.title: Files
outputProps.description: Array of file and directory information including name, size, modification time, and other properties based on the selected options.

optionProps.name: optIsDir
optionProps.title: Is Directory
optionProps.description: Include a boolean flag indicating whether each item is a directory.

optionProps.name: optModTime
optionProps.title: Modification Time
optionProps.description: Include the last modification timestamp for each file and directory.

optionProps.name: optCreateTime
optionProps.title: Creation Time
optionProps.description: Include the creation timestamp for each file and directory (or change time on Linux filesystems).

optionProps.name: optMode
optionProps.title: Mode
optionProps.description: Include the file permissions mode as a string (e.g., '-rw-r--r--').

optionProps.name: optSort
optionProps.title: Sort
optionProps.description: Sorting method for the file list. Files can be sorted by name or modification time in ascending or descending order.

optionProps.name: optTop
optionProps.title: Top
optionProps.description: Maximum number of files and directories to return in the result. Set to 0 or leave empty to return all items.

optionProps.name: optSize
optionProps.title: Size
optionProps.description: Include the size in bytes for each file (directories will have size 0).

optionProps.name: optAbsolutePath
optionProps.title: Absolute Path
optionProps.description: Return absolute paths for all files and directories instead of relative names.

optionProps.name: optName
optionProps.title: Name
optionProps.description: Include the file or directory name in the output results.

name: Create File/Dir
description: Creates a new file or directory at the specified path. The parent directory must exist.

inputProps.name: inPath
inputProps.title: Path
inputProps.description: The path to the file or directory to be processed.

outputProps.name: outPath
outputProps.title: Path
outputProps.description: The path of the created file or directory, returned as output for use in subsequent nodes.

optionProps.name: optType
optionProps.title: Type
optionProps.description: Specifies whether to create a file or directory. Files will be empty upon creation.

name: Copy File/Dir
description: Copies a file or directory from a source path to a destination path. The entire directory structure is preserved when copying directories.

inputProps.name: inSrcPath
inputProps.title: Source Path
inputProps.description: The path of the file or directory to be copied. This path must exist and be accessible.

inputProps.name: inDestPath
inputProps.title: Destination Path
inputProps.description: The path where the file or directory will be copied. The destination directory will be created if it doesn't exist.

name: Delete File/Dir
description: Deletes a file or directory. Can optionally filter by name pattern and recursively delete directory contents.

inputProps.name: inPath
inputProps.title: Path
inputProps.description: The path to the file or directory to be processed.

optionProps.name: optNameFilter
optionProps.title: Name Filter
optionProps.description: Pattern to match file/directory names for deletion (supports glob patterns). If empty, the specified path is deleted directly.

optionProps.name: optRecursive
optionProps.title: Recursive
optionProps.description: If true, deletes all files and subdirectories within the specified directory. If false, only deletes empty directories.

name: Move File/Dir
description: Moves a file or directory from one location to another. This operation renames the file/directory at the filesystem level.

inputProps.name: inSrcPath
inputProps.title: Source Path
inputProps.description: The path of the file or directory to be copied. This path must exist and be accessible.

inputProps.name: inDestPath
inputProps.title: Destination Path
inputProps.description: The path where the file or directory will be copied. The destination directory will be created if it doesn't exist.

name: Path Exists
description: Checks if a file or directory exists at the specified path and returns a boolean result.

inputProps.name: inPath
inputProps.title: Path
inputProps.description: The path to the file or directory to be processed.

outputProps.name: outResult
outputProps.title: Result
outputProps.description: Boolean value indicating whether the path exists (true) or not (false).

name: Read File
description: Reads the contents of a file and returns it as text or base64-encoded binary data.

inputProps.name: inPath
inputProps.title: Path
inputProps.description: The path to the file or directory to be processed.

outputProps.name: outContent
outputProps.title: Content
outputProps.description: The content of the file as a string. If Base64 option is enabled, contains base64-encoded binary data.

optionProps.name: optBase64
optionProps.title: Base64
optionProps.description: If true, reads the file as binary data and returns it base64-encoded. If false, reads as text using UTF-8 encoding.

name: Write File
description: Writes text or binary data to a file. Can append to existing files or create new files.

inputProps.name: inPath
inputProps.title: Path
inputProps.description: The path to the file or directory to be processed.

inputProps.name: inText
inputProps.title: Text
inputProps.description: The text content to write to the file. If Base64 option is enabled, this should be base64-encoded binary data.

optionProps.name: optMode
optionProps.title: Write Mode
optionProps.description: Specifies whether to append to the existing file content or truncate (overwrite) the file completely.

optionProps.name: optBase64
optionProps.title: Base64
optionProps.description: If true, reads the file as binary data and returns it base64-encoded. If false, reads as text using UTF-8 encoding.

name: Wait File
description: Waits for a file or directory to meet a specific condition (existence or deletion) within a timeout period.

inputProps.name: inPath
inputProps.title: Path
inputProps.description: The path to the file or directory to be processed.

outputProps.name: outFiles
outputProps.title: Files
outputProps.description: Array of file and directory information including name, size, modification time, and other properties based on the selected options.

optionProps.name: optCondition
optionProps.title: Condition
optionProps.description: The condition to wait for: 'To Exist' waits for the file/directory to appear, 'Until Deleted' waits for it to be removed.

optionProps.name: optNameFilter
optionProps.title: Name Filter
optionProps.description: Pattern to match file/directory names for deletion (supports glob patterns). If empty, the specified path is deleted directly.

optionProps.name: optName
optionProps.title: Name
optionProps.description: Include the file or directory name in the output results.

optionProps.name: optSize
optionProps.title: Size
optionProps.description: Include the size in bytes for each file (directories will have size 0).

optionProps.name: optMode
optionProps.title: Mode
optionProps.description: Include the file permissions mode as a string (e.g., '-rw-r--r--').

optionProps.name: optTimeout
optionProps.title: Timeout (sec)
optionProps.description: Maximum time to wait for the condition to be met, in seconds. If exceeded, the node will timeout and return an error.

optionProps.name: optIsDir
optionProps.title: Is Directory
optionProps.description: Include a boolean flag indicating whether each item is a directory.

optionProps.name: optModTime
optionProps.title: Modification Time
optionProps.description: Include the last modification timestamp for each file and directory.

optionProps.name: optCreateTime
optionProps.title: Creation Time
optionProps.description: Include the creation timestamp for each file and directory (or change time on Linux filesystems).

name: Tree
description: Creates a tree structure of files and directories starting from the specified root directory, with optional filtering by creation and modification dates.

outputProps.name: outFiles
outputProps.title: Files
outputProps.description: Array of file and directory information including name, size, modification time, and other properties based on the selected options.

optionProps.name: optOnlyDirs
optionProps.title: Only Directories
optionProps.description: If true, only includes directories in the tree structure and excludes all files.

optionProps.name: optCreatedAfter
optionProps.title: Created After
optionProps.description: Only include files and directories created after this timestamp (ISO 8601 format).

optionProps.name: optModifiedAfter
optionProps.title: Modified After
optionProps.description: Only include files and directories modified after this timestamp (ISO 8601 format).

name: Change Encoding
description: Converts a file from one character encoding to another. Reads the input file with the specified source encoding and saves it to the output path with the target encoding.

inputProps.name: inPath
inputProps.title: Source File Path
inputProps.description: The path to the input file that will be converted from one encoding to another. Must be a valid file path that exists on the filesystem.

inputProps.name: inSavePath
inputProps.title: Destination File Path
inputProps.description: The path where the converted file will be saved with the new encoding. The directory must exist, but the file will be created or overwritten.

optionProps.name: optSaveEncoding
optionProps.title: Target Encoding
optionProps.description: The character encoding to use when saving the converted file. The file content will be encoded using this format. Unsupported characters will be replaced with the encoding's substitute character.

optionProps.name: optOpenEncoding
optionProps.title: Source Encoding
optionProps.description: The character encoding of the input file. This encoding will be used to decode the file content for conversion to the target encoding.

name: File Stat
description: Returns complete information about a specific file or directory including name, absolute path, size, creation time, modification time, permissions, and type.

inputProps.name: inFilePath
inputProps.title: File Path
inputProps.description: The path to the file or directory to get information about. Must be a valid path that exists on the filesystem.

outputProps.name: outFileInfo
outputProps.title: File Information
outputProps.description: Complete information about the file or directory including name, absolute path, type, size, creation time, modification time, and permissions.

name: Comment
description: Adds documentation and notes to workflows with markdown formatting. Provides visual annotations without affecting workflow execution flow.

optionProps.name: optText
optionProps.title: Text
optionProps.description: Additional text content for extended documentation and workflow annotations.

optionProps.name: comment
optionProps.title: Comment
optionProps.description: The markdown-formatted text content for documentation and notes within the workflow.

name: Go To
description: Redirects workflow execution to specific Label nodes, enabling conditional branching and loop constructs. Supports jumping to single or multiple labels.

name: Label
description: Creates named jump destinations for Go To nodes. Acts as a marker in workflow execution allowing for complex control flow patterns and loops.

name: Fork Branch
description: Creates parallel execution branches from a single workflow path. Generates unique wait group and branch IDs for synchronization with Join Branch nodes.

outputProps.name: outWaitGroupID
outputProps.title: Wait Group Id
outputProps.description: Unique identifier for the wait group that synchronizes parallel branches. Used by Join Branch nodes to coordinate execution.

outputProps.name: outBranchID
outputProps.title: Branch Id
outputProps.description: Unique identifier for this specific branch within the wait group. Tracks individual branch completion status.

optionProps.name: optNofBranches
optionProps.title: Number of Branches
optionProps.description: The number of parallel execution branches to create. Each branch can execute independently and can be synchronized using Join Branch nodes.

name: Log
description: Writes log messages with configurable severity levels (trace, debug, info, warn, error). Essential for debugging and monitoring workflow execution.

inputProps.name: inText
inputProps.title: Text
inputProps.description: The message content to write to the log. Can include variable data and formatted text for debugging and monitoring.

optionProps.name: optLevel
optionProps.title: Log Level
optionProps.description: The severity level of the log message. Higher levels (error, warn) are more likely to be displayed in production environments.

name: Stop
description: Terminates workflow execution with specified status (success/failed) and optional reason. Provides controlled workflow termination points.

optionProps.name: optSuccess
optionProps.title: Status
optionProps.description: The final execution status to report when stopping the workflow. Success indicates normal completion, Failed indicates an error condition.

optionProps.name: optReason
optionProps.title: Reason
optionProps.description: Optional text explanation for why the workflow was stopped. Useful for debugging and error reporting.

name: Sub Flow
description: Executes reusable workflow components as embedded sub-processes. Enables modular workflow design with configurable input/output ports.

outputProps.name: outputs
outputProps.title: Outputs
outputProps.description: The number of output ports for the sub-flow. Determines how many different execution paths can exit from this sub-flow.

optionProps.name: subflow
optionProps.description: The identifier or reference to the sub-flow workflow to execute within this node.

name: Should Stop
description: Checks if workflow execution should be terminated based on system conditions or external requests. Returns boolean result for conditional stopping logic.

outputProps.name: outResult
outputProps.title: Should Stop
outputProps.description: Boolean result indicating whether the workflow should be terminated. True means stop execution, false means continue.

name: Create Form
description: Creates a dynamic web form with custom fields and validation rules. Forms can be linked to queues for automated processing of submissions and support customizable styling.

inputProps.name: inFormName
inputProps.title: Form Name
inputProps.description: The display name for the form. This will be shown to users when they access the form.

inputProps.name: inDescription
inputProps.title: Description
inputProps.description: Optional description text that appears below the form title to explain the form's purpose to users.

inputProps.name: inQueueName
inputProps.title: Queue Name
inputProps.description: Name of the queue where form submissions will be stored for processing. The queue must exist before form submissions can be processed.

outputProps.name: outFormID
outputProps.title: Form ID
outputProps.description: Unique identifier for the created form. Use this ID to reference the form in other operations like creating instances or updates.

optionProps.name: func
optionProps.title: Form Schema
optionProps.description: JSON schema defining the form structure, fields, validation rules, and UI configuration.

optionProps.name: optCredentials
optionProps.title: Credentials
optionProps.description: RSA key pair credentials from vault for form security and encryption. Required for secure form operations.

optionProps.name: optColor
optionProps.title: Theme Color
optionProps.description: Primary color for form styling in hex format (e.g., #fb741a). This color is used for buttons, highlights, and branding elements.

optionProps.name: optLogoURL
optionProps.title: Logo URL
optionProps.description: URL of the logo image to display in the form header. Should be a publicly accessible image URL.

name: Create Form Instance
description: Creates an instance of an existing form that can be accessed by users. Form instances can be disposable (single-use) or permanent (reusable) and generate unique URLs for form access.

inputProps.name: inFormID
inputProps.title: Form ID
inputProps.description: The unique identifier of the form to create an instance from. This must be a valid form ID from a previously created form.

outputProps.name: outFormInstanceID
outputProps.title: Form Instance ID
outputProps.description: Unique identifier for the created form instance. Use this to manage or delete the instance later.

outputProps.name: outFormURL
outputProps.title: Form URL
outputProps.description: The public URL where users can access the form. Share this URL to allow users to fill out and submit the form.

optionProps.name: optFormInstanceType
optionProps.title: Instance Type
optionProps.description: Disposable instances are deleted after first submission, while permanent instances remain available for multiple submissions.

name: Update Form
description: Updates an existing form's configuration including name, description, queue settings, and form schema. Allows modification of form structure and properties after creation.

inputProps.name: inFormId
inputProps.title: Form ID
inputProps.description: The unique identifier of the form to update. Must be a valid existing form ID.

inputProps.name: inFormName
inputProps.title: Form Name
inputProps.description: Updated display name for the form. This will replace the existing form name.

inputProps.name: inDescription
inputProps.title: Description
inputProps.description: Updated description text for the form. This will replace the existing description.

inputProps.name: inQueueName
inputProps.title: Queue Name
inputProps.description: Updated queue name where form submissions will be stored. The new queue must exist before submissions can be processed.

outputProps.name: outFormId
outputProps.title: Form ID
outputProps.description: The ID of the updated form. This confirms the form was successfully modified.

optionProps.name: func
optionProps.title: Form Schema
optionProps.description: Updated JSON schema defining the form structure, fields, validation rules, and UI configuration.

optionProps.name: optCredentials
optionProps.title: Credentials
optionProps.description: RSA key pair credentials from vault required for form update operations and security.

name: Delete Form
description: Permanently deletes a form and all its associated data. This operation cannot be undone and will also remove all form instances.

inputProps.name: inFormID
inputProps.title: Form ID
inputProps.description: The unique identifier of the form to permanently delete. All associated instances and data will be removed.

name: Delete Form Instance
description: Removes a specific form instance, making it no longer accessible to users. The base form remains intact and other instances are unaffected.

inputProps.name: inFormInstanceID
inputProps.title: Form Instance ID
inputProps.description: The unique identifier of the form instance to delete. This will disable the instance URL and prevent further access.

name: Get Form Instance
description: Retrieves form submission data from a specific form instance. Returns the submitted form data and metadata for processing or analysis.

inputProps.name: inFormInstanceID
inputProps.title: Form Instance ID
inputProps.description: The unique identifier of the form instance to retrieve submission data from.

outputProps.name: outForm
outputProps.title: Form Data
outputProps.description: The submitted form data including all field values, metadata, and submission timestamp.

name: List Forms
description: Retrieves a list of all available forms in the workspace. Returns form metadata including IDs, names, descriptions, and creation timestamps.

outputProps.name: outForms
outputProps.title: Forms List
outputProps.description: Array of form objects containing form metadata, IDs, and configuration details for all available forms.

name: Connect
description: Establishes a connection to an FTP, SFTP, or FTPS server using the specified credentials and returns a session ID for subsequent operations.

inputProps.name: inHost
inputProps.title: Host
inputProps.description: The hostname or IP address of the FTP server to connect to. Cannot be empty. Example: 'ftp.example.com' or '192.168.1.100'.

inputProps.name: inPort
inputProps.title: Port
inputProps.description: The port number to connect to on the FTP server. Cannot be zero. Standard ports: FTP (21), SFTP (22), FTPS (990). Example: 21.

outputProps.name: outSessionId
outputProps.title: Session Id
outputProps.description: A unique identifier for the established FTP session. Use this session ID in subsequent FTP operations to perform file transfers and directory operations.

optionProps.name: optFtpType
optionProps.title: FTP Type
optionProps.description: The protocol type to use for the connection. FTP (unencrypted), SFTP (SSH File Transfer Protocol - secure), or FTPS (FTP over SSL/TLS - secure).

optionProps.name: optSkipTLSVerification
optionProps.title: Skip TLS Verification
optionProps.description: When enabled, skips SSL/TLS certificate verification for secure connections (FTPS/SFTP). Use with caution as this reduces security by not verifying server identity.

optionProps.name: optCredentials
optionProps.title: Login Credentials
optionProps.description: Username and password credentials stored in the vault for authenticating with the FTP server. Both vault and item must be selected.

optionProps.name: optPrivateKey
optionProps.title: Private Key Path
optionProps.description: Optional for SFTP and FTPS, required when connecting with a private key file.

optionProps.name: optPassphrase
optionProps.title: Private Key Passphrase
optionProps.description: Optional passphrase for the private key, if the key is password-protected.

optionProps.name: optCertificate
optionProps.title: Certificate Path
optionProps.description: Optional for FTPS, required when connecting with a private key file.

name: Disconnect
description: Closes an active FTP connection using the provided session ID and performs cleanup operations.

inputProps.name: inSessionId
inputProps.title: Session Id
inputProps.description: The session ID of the active FTP connection to be closed. This should be the session ID returned from a successful FTP Connect operation.

name: Download
description: Downloads a file from the FTP server to the local file system using the specified session ID and file paths.

inputProps.name: inSessionId
inputProps.title: Session Id
inputProps.description: The session ID of an active FTP connection. This should be the session ID returned from a successful FTP Connect operation.

inputProps.name: inFtpPath
inputProps.title: FTP File Path
inputProps.description: The path to the file on the FTP server that will be downloaded. Must be a valid file path on the remote server. Example: '/remote/directory/file.txt'.

inputProps.name: inLocalPath
inputProps.title: Local File Path
inputProps.description: The destination path where the file will be saved on the local file system. Include the filename in the path. Example: 'C:\downloads\file.txt'.

name: Upload
description: Uploads a file from the local file system to the FTP server using the specified session ID and file paths.

inputProps.name: inSessionId
inputProps.title: Session Id
inputProps.description: The session ID of an active FTP connection. This should be the session ID returned from a successful FTP Connect operation.

inputProps.name: inFtpPath
inputProps.title: FTP File Path
inputProps.description: The destination path on the FTP server where the file will be uploaded. Include the filename in the path. Example: '/remote/directory/file.txt'.

inputProps.name: inLocalPath
inputProps.title: Local File Path
inputProps.description: The path to the file on the local file system that will be uploaded. Must be a valid existing file. Example: 'C:\local\file.txt'.

name: File Exists
description: Checks if a file or directory exists on the FTP server at the specified path and returns a boolean result.

inputProps.name: inSessionId
inputProps.title: Session Id
inputProps.description: The session ID of an active FTP connection. This should be the session ID returned from a successful FTP Connect operation.

inputProps.name: inFtpPath
inputProps.title: FTP File Path
inputProps.description: The path to the file or directory on the FTP server to check for existence. Example: '/remote/directory/file.txt' or '/remote/directory/'.

outputProps.name: outResult
outputProps.title: Result
outputProps.description: Boolean value indicating whether the specified file or directory exists (true) or not (false) on the FTP server.

name: Create Directory
description: Creates a new directory on the FTP server at the specified path using the active session.

inputProps.name: inSessionId
inputProps.title: Session Id
inputProps.description: The session ID of an active FTP connection. This should be the session ID returned from a successful FTP Connect operation.

inputProps.name: inFtpDirPath
inputProps.title: Ftp Directory Path
inputProps.description: The path where the new directory will be created on the FTP server. Parent directory must exist. Example: '/remote/path/new-directory'.

outputProps.name: outPath
outputProps.title: Path
outputProps.description: The path of the created directory, returned as output for use in subsequent nodes. This will be the same as the input path if successful.

name: List Directory
description: Lists files and directories in the specified path on the FTP server with sorting and filtering options.

inputProps.name: inSessionId
inputProps.title: Session Id
inputProps.description: The session ID of an active FTP connection. This should be the session ID returned from a successful FTP Connect operation.

inputProps.name: inFtpDirPath
inputProps.title: Ftp Directory Path
inputProps.description: The path to the directory on the FTP server to list. Must be a valid directory path. Example: '/remote/directory/' or '/' for root.

outputProps.name: outFiles
outputProps.title: Files
outputProps.description: Array of file and directory information including names, sizes, dates, and other properties from the specified FTP directory.

optionProps.name: optSort
optionProps.title: Sort
optionProps.description: Sorting method for the directory listing. Files and directories can be sorted by name or modification date in ascending or descending order.

optionProps.name: optTop
optionProps.title: Top
optionProps.description: Maximum number of items to return in the result. Set to 0 to return all items without limitation. Items are returned after sorting is applied.

name: Delete Directory
description: Removes a directory from the FTP server at the specified path using the active session.

inputProps.name: inSessionId
inputProps.title: Session Id
inputProps.description: The session ID of an active FTP connection. This should be the session ID returned from a successful FTP Connect operation.

inputProps.name: inFtpDirPath
inputProps.title: Ftp Directory Path
inputProps.description: The path to the directory on the FTP server that will be deleted. The directory must be empty before it can be removed. Example: '/remote/directory/'.

name: Delete File
description: Removes a file from the FTP server at the specified path. The file must exist before it can be deleted.

inputProps.name: inSessionId
inputProps.title: Session Id
inputProps.description: The session ID of an active FTP connection. This should be the session ID returned from a successful FTP Connect operation.

inputProps.name: inFtpFilePath
inputProps.title: Ftp File Path
inputProps.description: The path to the file on the FTP server that will be deleted. The file must exist before deletion. Example: '/remote/directory/file.txt'.

name: Move File
description: Moves or renames a file on the FTP server from a source path to a destination path. The source file must exist and be a file (not a directory).

inputProps.name: inFtpSrcPath
inputProps.title: Ftp Source File Path
inputProps.description: The path to the existing file on the FTP server that will be moved. Must be a valid file path (not a directory). Example: '/remote/old-location/file.txt'.

inputProps.name: inFtpDstPath
inputProps.title: Ftp Destination File Path
inputProps.description: The destination path where the file will be moved on the FTP server. Can be used to rename the file. Example: '/remote/new-location/file.txt'.

inputProps.name: inSessionId
inputProps.title: Session Id
inputProps.description: The session ID of an active FTP connection. This should be the session ID returned from a successful FTP Connect operation.

name: Type Text
description: Types text into the active window or element, simulating keyboard input with customizable typing speed and optional Enter key press.
