inputProps.name: inText
inputProps.title: Text
inputProps.description: The text string to be typed into the active window or input field. Supports variables and can include special characters and line breaks.

optionProps.name: optEnter
optionProps.title: Press Enter
optionProps.description: If enabled, automatically presses the Enter key after typing the text. Useful for submitting forms or executing commands.

optionProps.name: optCpm
optionProps.title: Characters per Minute
optionProps.description: Typing speed in characters per minute (CPM). Must be between 0-1000. Set to 0 for instant typing without delay. Higher values result in faster typing.

name: Send Keys
description: Sends keyboard key combinations and special keys, including modifier keys (Ctrl, Alt, Shift) and function keys. Supports up to 3 simultaneous key modifiers.

inputProps.name: inKey
inputProps.title: Key
inputProps.description: The primary key to press. Can be any letter, number, or special key name (e.g., 'a', '1', 'enter', 'escape'). Leave empty to press only modifier keys.

optionProps.name: optMod1
optionProps.title: Key Modifier 1
optionProps.description: First modifier key to hold while pressing the main key. Common combinations: Ctrl+C (copy), Alt+Tab (switch windows), Shift+Arrow (select text).

optionProps.name: optMod2
optionProps.title: Key Modifier 2
optionProps.description: Second modifier key for complex key combinations. Used for triple-key shortcuts like Ctrl+Shift+T (reopen closed tab) or Ctrl+Alt+Delete. Combines with Key Modifier 1 if both are set.

optionProps.name: optMod3
optionProps.title: Key Modifier 3
optionProps.description: Third modifier key for advanced key combinations. Allows for complex shortcuts that require multiple simultaneous modifier keys. Combines with Key Modifier 1 and 2 if all are set.

name: Connect
description: Establishes a connection to a mail server using basic authentication or OAuth2. Creates a client session for accessing mail operations like reading, sending, and managing emails.

outputProps.name: outClientId
outputProps.title: Client Id
outputProps.description: Unique identifier for the mail server connection. Used to reference this specific connection in other mail operations.

optionProps.name: optTokenCredentials
optionProps.title: OAuth2 Token Credentials
optionProps.description: Required only if OAuth2 Authentication Type is selected. Needs a Document Category Type credential created inside a vault that contains {'client_id':'<your_client_id>', 'client_secret':'<your_client_secret>'}. OAuth2 Client ID and Client Secret values should be obtained from your mail provider.

optionProps.name: optAuthenticationType
optionProps.title: Authentication Type
optionProps.description: Method of authentication: Basic (username/password) or OAuth2 (token-based). OAuth2 is required for modern providers like Gmail and Outlook.

optionProps.name: optEmailCredentials
optionProps.title: Mail Server Credentials
optionProps.description: Email credentials from vault containing server settings (host, port, username, password) for IMAP and SMTP connections. Required for basic authentication.

name: Disconnect
description: Closes an active mail server connection and cleans up associated resources. Should be called when mail operations are complete.

inputProps.name: inClientId
inputProps.title: Client Id
inputProps.description: The client connection identifier to disconnect. Must match a client ID from a previous Connect node operation.

name: Send Mail
description: Sends email messages with support for attachments, HTML/plain text body, multiple recipients (To, CC, BCC), and Reply All functionality. Works with basic authentication or OAuth2 connections. Reply All mode automatically populates recipients from original emails.

inputProps.name: inTo
inputProps.title: To
inputProps.description: Primary recipient email addresses. Multiple addresses can be separated by commas (e.g., 'user1@example.com,user2@example.com').

inputProps.name: inCc
inputProps.title: Cc
inputProps.description: Carbon copy recipients who will receive a copy of the email. Multiple addresses can be separated by commas. Optional field.

inputProps.name: inBcc
inputProps.title: Bcc
inputProps.description: Blind carbon copy recipients who will receive the email without other recipients knowing. Multiple addresses separated by commas. Optional field.

inputProps.name: inReplyTo
inputProps.title: Reply To
inputProps.description: Email address where replies should be sent. If specified, recipients can reply to this address instead of the From address.

inputProps.name: inSubject
inputProps.title: Subject
inputProps.description: Email subject line. This will appear in the recipient's inbox as the email title.

inputProps.name: inBody
inputProps.title: Body
inputProps.description: Main content of the email. Can be plain text or HTML depending on the 'HTML Body' option setting.

inputProps.name: inReplyToMailID
inputProps.title: Reply To Mail ID
inputProps.description: Mailbox and UID of the original email to reply to (format: INBOX/12345). This field is required when Reply All Mode is enabled. Use the 'MailboxUID' field from GetMail or SearchMail output.

inputProps.name: inClientId
inputProps.title: Client Id
inputProps.description: Connection identifier for OAuth2 authentication. If using basic authentication, this is not required as credentials are provided in Options.

inputProps.name: inFrom
inputProps.title: From
inputProps.description: Sender's email address. Must be a valid email format (e.g., 'sender@example.com'). Required field.

optionProps.name: optHtmlBody
optionProps.title: HTML Body
optionProps.description: If true, treats the body content as HTML and renders it in the email client. If false, sends as plain text.

optionProps.name: optIncludeOriginalMessage
optionProps.title: Include Original Message
optionProps.description: When enabled with Reply/Reply All/Forward modes, includes the original email content with proper quote formatting in the body. The formatting style is controlled by Quote Style option.

optionProps.name: optIncludeOriginalAttachments
optionProps.title: Include Original Attachments
optionProps.description: When enabled with Reply/Reply All/Forward modes, includes all attachments (including embedded images with preserved Content-IDs) from the original email. Typically used with Forward mode to match Gmail/Outlook behavior.

optionProps.name: optUseAttachmentIndexAsCID
optionProps.title: Attachment Index As CID
optionProps.description: Use this option to embed images in an email with in your HTML body. HTML Body option has to be selected, too. The '0' here represents the index of the attachments array, which will be used as the Content-ID for the attachment.

optionProps.name: optMessageMode
optionProps.title: Message Mode
optionProps.description: Select the type of email to send: New Email (default), Reply (to sender only), Reply All (to sender and all recipients), or Forward (to new recipients). Reply/Reply All/Forward require Reply To Mail ID to be provided.

optionProps.name: optQuoteStyle
optionProps.title: Quote Style
optionProps.description: Choose the formatting style for quoted original message: Gmail (modern blockquote), Outlook (traditional headers with separator), or Simple (basic > prefix). Only applies when Include Original Message is enabled.

optionProps.name: optAttachments
optionProps.title: Attachments
optionProps.description: Array of file paths to attach to the email. Files will be attached as email attachments that recipients can download.

optionProps.name: optCustomAttachments
optionProps.title: Custom Attachments
optionProps.description: Static list of file paths to attach to the email. Each entry should be a valid file path. Files will be attached as email attachments.

name: Delete Mail
description: Deletes specific email messages by UID or deletes all messages from a mail folder. Messages are marked for deletion and permanently removed from the server.

inputProps.name: inClientId
inputProps.title: Client Id
inputProps.description: Connection identifier from a Connect node. Required for mail server authentication and access.

inputProps.name: inMailFolder
inputProps.title: Mail Folder
inputProps.description: Name of the mail folder containing the messages to delete (e.g., 'INBOX', 'Sent', 'Drafts'). Folder must exist on the server.

inputProps.name: inUid
inputProps.title: Messages Id
inputProps.description: Unique identifier (UID) of the specific message to delete. If 'Delete All' option is enabled, this parameter is ignored and all messages in the folder are deleted.

optionProps.name: optDeleteAll
optionProps.title: Delete All
optionProps.description: If true, deletes all messages in the specified folder. If false, deletes only the message with the specified Messages Id (UID).

name: Get Mail
description: Retrieves email messages from a specified mail folder. Can fetch a limited number of messages, filter for unread messages, and optionally mark messages as read.

name: Search Mail
description: Searches for email messages based on various criteria including sender, recipient, subject, body content, date range, and message ID. Returns matching messages or just their IDs.

name: Save Attachments
description: Downloads and saves email attachments from a specific message to a local directory. Returns the full paths of downloaded files.

name: Move Mail
description: Moves a specific email message from one mail folder to another using the message's unique identifier (UID).

name: Create Folder
description: Creates a new mail folder on the server with the specified name. The folder can then be used to organize and store email messages.

name: Delete Folder
description: Permanently deletes a mail folder from the server. The folder must be empty or the operation may fail depending on server configuration.

name: List Folders
description: Retrieves a list of all available mail folders from the server. Returns an array of folder names that can be used in other mail operations.

name: Mouse Click
description: Performs mouse clicks at specified coordinates with configurable button types, click modes, and key modifiers. Supports single/double clicks and press/release actions.

inputProps.name: inX
inputProps.title: X Coordinate
inputProps.description: The horizontal pixel position (X coordinate) on the screen where the mouse click should occur. Use 0 for the leftmost edge.

inputProps.name: inY
inputProps.title: Y Coordinate
inputProps.description: The vertical pixel position (Y coordinate) on the screen where the mouse click should occur. Use 0 for the topmost edge.

optionProps.name: optClickType
optionProps.title: Click Type
optionProps.description: The type of click action to perform. Single click for most actions, double click for opening items, button press/release for drag operations.

optionProps.name: optKeyModifier
optionProps.title: Key Modifier
optionProps.description: Optional keyboard key to hold while clicking. Use Ctrl for control-click, Shift for shift-click, etc. Set to None for regular clicks.

optionProps.name: optButtonType
optionProps.title: Mouse Button
optionProps.description: Which mouse button to use for the click action. Left button is most common for regular clicks, right button for context menus.

name: Mouse Drag
description: Performs mouse drag operations by moving the mouse pointer while holding down a mouse button. Uses delta X and Y values for relative movement.

name: Mouse Hover
description: Moves the mouse pointer to specified coordinates without clicking. Supports smooth movement animation for natural mouse positioning.

inputProps.name: inX
inputProps.title: X Coordinate
inputProps.description: The horizontal pixel position (X coordinate) on the screen where the mouse click should occur. Use 0 for the leftmost edge.

inputProps.name: inY
inputProps.title: Y Coordinate
inputProps.description: The vertical pixel position (Y coordinate) on the screen where the mouse click should occur. Use 0 for the topmost edge.

name: Mouse Scroll
description: Simulates mouse wheel scrolling with configurable direction (up/down) and line count. Useful for navigating through scrollable content and web pages.

name: Http In
description: Creates an HTTP server that listens for incoming requests on the specified IP, port, and endpoint. Supports GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, and PATCH methods.

outputProps.name: outHeaders
outputProps.title: Headers
outputProps.description: HTTP headers from the incoming request as key-value pairs. Header names are converted to lowercase.

outputProps.name: outCookies
outputProps.title: Cookies
outputProps.description: HTTP cookies from the incoming request as key-value pairs with lowercase cookie names.

outputProps.name: outQueryParams
outputProps.title: Query Params
outputProps.description: URL query parameters extracted from the request URL as key-value pairs.

outputProps.name: outPathParams
outputProps.title: Path Params
outputProps.description: Path parameters extracted from the URL pattern (e.g., /users/:id) as key-value pairs.

outputProps.name: outBody
outputProps.title: Body
outputProps.description: The request body content extracted from the incoming HTTP request. Returns the JSON object if the body is valid JSON, otherwise returns the raw body as a string.

optionProps.name: optMethod
optionProps.title: Method
optionProps.description: HTTP method that this endpoint will respond to. Multiple methods can be selected to support different HTTP verbs.

optionProps.name: optEndpointV2
optionProps.title: Endpoint
optionProps.description: The URL path where this HTTP server will listen (e.g., /api/users). Must start with '/' for proper routing.

optionProps.name: optIPv2
optionProps.title: IP
optionProps.description: IP address to bind the HTTP server. Defaults to 127.0.0.1 if not specified. Must be a valid IP address format.

optionProps.name: optPortv2
optionProps.title: Port
optionProps.description: Port number for the HTTP server to listen on. Defaults to 9090 if not specified. Must be a valid port number (1-65535).

name: Http Out
description: Sends an HTTP response to a corresponding Http In node. Supports custom headers, cookies, file attachments, and status codes. The response is constructed from incoming message variables and sent back to the waiting HTTP client.

inputProps.name: inBody
inputProps.title: Body
inputProps.description: The response body content to send back to the client. Can be a string, JSON object, or any serializable data. If JSON, will be automatically serialized with proper headers.

inputProps.name: inHeaders
inputProps.title: Headers
inputProps.description: HTTP headers to include in the response as key-value pairs. Header names are converted to lowercase. Merged with custom headers before sending.

inputProps.name: inCustomHeaders
inputProps.title: Custom Headers
inputProps.description: Array of custom HTTP headers to include in the response. Each header has a name-value pair. These headers are merged with the headers from the Headers input parameter.

inputProps.name: inCookies
inputProps.title: Cookies
inputProps.description: HTTP cookies to include in the response as key-value pairs. Cookie names are converted to lowercase. Merged with custom cookies before sending.

inputProps.name: inCustomCookies
inputProps.title: Custom Cookies
inputProps.description: Array of custom HTTP cookies to include in the response. Each cookie has a name-value pair. These cookies are merged with the cookies from the Cookies input parameter.

inputProps.name: inAttachment
inputProps.title: Attachment Path
inputProps.description: Path to a file that will be attached to the response and sent as a file download. If specified, the file content will override the body content. The file must exist and be accessible.

inputProps.name: inStatus
inputProps.title: Status Code
inputProps.description: HTTP status code to send in the response (e.g., 200, 404, 500). Must be a valid HTTP status code between 100-599.

name: Http Request
description: Makes HTTP requests to external URLs with support for GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, and PATCH methods. Includes authentication, proxy support, cookie management, and streaming capabilities.

inputProps.name: inBody
inputProps.title: Request
inputProps.description: The request body/data to send with the HTTP request. For POST/PUT/PATCH, this contains the data that will be sent in the request body. Can be JSON, form data, or raw text.

inputProps.name: inHeaders
inputProps.title: Headers
inputProps.description: HTTP headers to include in the request as key-value pairs. Header names are converted to lowercase and merged with custom headers.

inputProps.name: inCustomHeaders
inputProps.title: Custom Headers
inputProps.description: Array of custom HTTP headers to include in the request. Each header has a name-value pair. These headers are merged with the headers from the Headers input parameter.

inputProps.name: inCookies
inputProps.title: Cookies
inputProps.description: HTTP cookies to include in the request as key-value pairs. Cookie names are converted to lowercase and merged with custom cookies. Format: {'sId':'3874d5700cc248118', '_rM':'random'}

inputProps.name: inCookieStore
inputProps.title: Raw Cookies
inputProps.description: Cookie jar containing session cookies that will be automatically managed across requests. Updated with cookies received in the response for maintaining session state. Format: [{'name': 'sessionID', 'value': '3874d5700cc248118', 'path': '/', 'domain': 'example.com', 'expires': '2024-12-31T23:59:59Z', 'maxAge': 3600, 'secure': true, 'httpOnly': true, 'sameSite': 2}]

inputProps.name: inCustomCookies
inputProps.title: Custom Cookies
inputProps.description: Array of custom HTTP cookies to include in the request. Each cookie has a name-value pair. These cookies are merged with the cookies from the Cookies input parameter.

outputProps.name: outHeaders
outputProps.title: Headers
outputProps.description: HTTP headers from the response as key-value pairs. Header names are converted to lowercase.

outputProps.name: outCookies
outputProps.title: Cookies
outputProps.description: HTTP cookies from the response as key-value pairs. Cookie names are converted to lowercase.

outputProps.name: outCookieStore
outputProps.title: Raw Cookies
outputProps.description: Updated cookie jar with all cookies received in the response. Includes session cookies that can be reused in subsequent requests.

outputProps.name: outStatus
outputProps.title: Status Code
outputProps.description: HTTP status code from the response (e.g., 200, 404, 500). Indicates the success or failure of the HTTP request.

outputProps.name: outStreamIndex
outputProps.title: Stream Index
outputProps.description: Index number when streaming is enabled. Each streamed response chunk gets a unique index, with the final message having an EOF marker.

outputProps.name: outBody
outputProps.title: Response
outputProps.description: The HTTP response body. Returns JSON object if Content-Type is application/json, otherwise returns raw response as string. Base64 encoded if Encode as Base64 option is enabled.

optionProps.name: optUrl
optionProps.title: URL
optionProps.description: The target URL for the HTTP request. Can include protocol (http/https), domain, path, and query parameters. Automatically adds http:// if protocol is missing.

optionProps.name: optMethod
optionProps.title: Method
optionProps.description: HTTP method to use for the request. GET for retrieving data, POST for sending data, PUT for updating resources, DELETE for removing resources, PATCH for partial updates.

optionProps.name: optAuthentication
optionProps.title: Authentication
optionProps.description: Authentication method for the HTTP request. 'No Authentication' sends the request without authentication. 'Basic Authentication' adds username/password from vault credentials.

optionProps.name: optCredentials
optionProps.title: Credentials
optionProps.description: Vault credentials containing username and password for basic HTTP authentication. Required when 'Basic Authentication' is selected.

optionProps.name: optEnableDebugging
optionProps.title: Enable Debugging
optionProps.description: If true, logs detailed HTTP request and response information to the console in cURL format for debugging purposes.

optionProps.name: optProxyAddr
optionProps.title: Proxy Address
optionProps.description: Proxy server address including host and port (e.g., proxy.example.com:8080). Required when 'Manual Proxy' is selected.

optionProps.name: optProxyAuth
optionProps.title: Proxy Authentication
optionProps.description: Authentication method for the proxy server. 'No Authentication' connects without credentials, 'Basic Authentication' uses proxy credentials from vault.

optionProps.name: optCustomRobomotionParameters
optionProps.title: Robomotion Proxy Parameters
optionProps.description: Additional parameters to pass to the Robomotion proxy service. Each parameter is a name-value pair that controls proxy behavior.

optionProps.name: optTimeout
optionProps.title: Timeout (seconds)
optionProps.description: Maximum time to wait for the HTTP request to complete, in seconds. Defaults to 30 seconds if not specified.

optionProps.name: optInsecure
optionProps.title: Insecure Skip Verify
optionProps.description: If true, skips SSL certificate verification. Useful for self-signed certificates but reduces security. Only use in trusted environments.

optionProps.name: optBase64
optionProps.title: Encode as Base64
optionProps.description: If true, encodes the response body as Base64. Useful for binary data or when you need to handle the response as binary rather than text.

optionProps.name: optEnableStreaming
optionProps.title: Enable Streaming
optionProps.description: If true, enables response streaming. The response will be processed in chunks, with each chunk emitted as a separate message with a stream index.

optionProps.name: optProxy
optionProps.title: Proxy Settings
optionProps.description: Proxy configuration for the HTTP request. 'No Proxy' connects directly, 'Manual Proxy' uses specified proxy settings, 'Robomotion Proxy' routes through Robomotion's proxy service.

optionProps.name: optProxyCredentials
optionProps.title: Proxy Credentials
optionProps.description: Vault credentials containing username and password for proxy basic authentication. Required when 'Basic Authentication' is selected for proxy.

name: HTML Template
description: Renders HTML templates using Mustache syntax with data from input messages. Supports template variables, loops, and conditional rendering.

outputProps.name: outRendered
outputProps.title: Output
outputProps.description: The rendered HTML output after processing the template with input data. Template variables are replaced with corresponding values from the input message.

optionProps.name: func
optionProps.title: Function
optionProps.description: HTML template using Mustache syntax. Use {{variable}} syntax for placeholders that will be replaced with values from the input message.

inputProps.name: inUrl
inputProps.title: URL
inputProps.description: The URL of the file to download. Can include protocol (http/https), domain, and full path to the file. Must be a valid URL pointing to a downloadable resource.

inputProps.name: inPath
inputProps.title: Download Path
inputProps.description: The local file path where the downloaded file will be saved. Can be an absolute or relative path. The directory must exist or be creatable.

outputProps.name: outPath
outputProps.title: Path
outputProps.description: The actual path where the file was downloaded and saved. This can be used for verification or further processing of the downloaded file.

optionProps.name: optCredentials
optionProps.title: Basic Authentication
optionProps.description: Vault credentials containing username and password for basic HTTP authentication when downloading from protected resources.

optionProps.name: optCookieStore
optionProps.title: Cookies
optionProps.description: Optional JSON array of raw cookie objects for download authentication. Format: [{'name': 'sessionID', 'value': '3874d5700cc248118', 'path': '/', 'domain': 'example.com', 'expires': '2024-12-31T23:59:59Z', 'maxAge': 3600, 'secure': true, 'httpOnly': true, 'sameSite': 2}]

optionProps.name: optTimeout
optionProps.title: Timeout (seconds)
optionProps.description: Maximum time to wait for the download to complete, in seconds. Defaults to 60 seconds if not specified.

optionProps.name: optPattern
optionProps.title: TempFile Pattern
optionProps.description: Pattern for temporary file naming during download. If specified, a temporary file with this pattern will be created first, then moved to the final location upon completion.

name: Get Env Variable
description: Retrieves the value of a specified environment variable from the operating system.

inputProps.name: inVarName
inputProps.title: Variable Name
inputProps.description: The name of the environment variable to retrieve. For example: 'PATH', 'HOME', 'USER', or any custom environment variable name.

outputProps.name: outValue
outputProps.title: Value
outputProps.description: The value of the requested environment variable. Returns empty string if the variable is not set or doesn't exist.

name: Get Processes
description: Retrieves a list of running processes on the system, optionally filtered by process name using regex patterns.

inputProps.name: inNameFilter
inputProps.title: Name Filter (Regex)
inputProps.description: Regular expression pattern to filter processes by executable name or path. Leave empty to return all processes. Examples: 'chrome', '.*.exe$', 'notepad'.

outputProps.name: outPids
outputProps.title: Process Ids
outputProps.description: Array of process IDs (PIDs) for all matching processes. These can be used to identify or terminate specific processes.

outputProps.name: outExecs
outputProps.title: Executable Names
outputProps.description: Array of executable names or paths for all matching processes. These correspond to the process IDs in the same order.

name: Kill Process
description: Terminates a running process either by process ID or by name pattern. Can kill multiple processes matching the name pattern.

inputProps.name: inPid
inputProps.title: Process ID
inputProps.description: Specific process ID to terminate. If provided, this takes priority over Process Name. Use 0 or leave empty to use Process Name instead.

inputProps.name: inProcessName
inputProps.title: Process Name (Regex)
inputProps.description: Regular expression pattern to match process executable names. Used when Process ID is not specified. Examples: 'notepad', '.*chrome.*', 'java'.

name: Start Process
description: Launches a new process with the specified executable, arguments, and working directory. Can run in foreground or background mode.

inputProps.name: inFilePath
inputProps.title: Executable Path
inputProps.description: Full path to the executable file to run. Can be an absolute path or a program name in the system PATH. Examples: 'notepad.exe', '/usr/bin/python3', 'calculator'.

inputProps.name: inArguments
inputProps.title: Arguments
inputProps.description: Array of command-line arguments to pass to the executable. Each array element becomes a separate argument. Used when Custom Arguments is empty.

inputProps.name: inWorkingDir
inputProps.title: Working Directory
inputProps.description: The directory from which to run the process. This affects relative file paths used by the executable. Leave empty to use current directory.

inputProps.name: inCustomArgs
inputProps.title: Custom Arguments
inputProps.description: Static list of command-line arguments to pass to the executable. Takes priority over Arguments array when specified. Examples: '--help', '-v', '--config=file.json'.

outputProps.name: outPid
outputProps.title: Process ID
outputProps.description: The process ID of the started process. Use this ID to monitor or terminate the process later. Returns 0 if process couldn't be started.

outputProps.name: outStdout
outputProps.title: Standard Output
outputProps.description: Combined standard output and error from the process. Only available when Background Process is disabled (foreground mode).

optionProps.name: optBackground
optionProps.title: Background Process
optionProps.description: If enabled, starts the process in background without waiting for completion. If disabled, waits for process to finish and captures output.

name: Debug
description: Outputs debug information to console, logs, and visual debugging interface. Useful for inspecting message data and variable values during workflow execution.

optionProps.name: optSysConsole
optionProps.title: System Console
optionProps.description: Writes the Debug dumps into the Command Prompt (Windows) or the Terminal (Mac / Linux) only if the robot is started from command line

optionProps.name: optLogDebug
optionProps.title: Log Debug
optionProps.description: Writes the Debug dumps into the logs folder

optionProps.name: optDebugData
optionProps.title: Debug Data
optionProps.description: The primary variable or message property to debug. This will be the main data displayed in the debug output.

optionProps.name: optAdditionalFields
optionProps.title: Additional Fields
optionProps.description: Extra variables or message properties to include in the debug output. Useful for debugging multiple values simultaneously.

optionProps.name: optActive
optionProps.title: Active
optionProps.description: When enabled, the debug node will output debug information. When disabled, the node will pass through messages without any debug output.

name: Sleep
description: Pauses workflow execution for a specified duration in seconds. Supports both fixed delays and random delays within a range.

optionProps.name: optDuration
optionProps.title: Duration (sec)
optionProps.description: The number of seconds to pause execution. Used when Random is disabled. Supports decimal values for sub-second delays (e.g., 0.5 for 500ms).

optionProps.name: optRandom
optionProps.title: Random
optionProps.description: When enabled, uses a random delay between Random Min and Random Max values instead of the fixed Duration.

optionProps.name: optRandMin
optionProps.title: Random Min (sec)
optionProps.description: The minimum delay in seconds when Random is enabled. The actual delay will be randomly chosen between this value and Random Max.

optionProps.name: optRandMax
optionProps.title: Random Max (sec)
optionProps.description: The maximum delay in seconds when Random is enabled. Must be greater than Random Min to generate valid random delays.

name: Function
description: Executes custom JavaScript code with access to message data, global/flow variables, and local variables. Supports multiple outputs and timeout handling.

outputProps.name: outputs
outputProps.title: Outputs
outputProps.description: Number of output ports for this node (1-32). Return an array from your function with values for each output, or a single value for one output.

optionProps.name: optTimeout
optionProps.title: Script Timeout
optionProps.description: Maximum execution time in seconds before the script is terminated. Prevents infinite loops and long-running operations from blocking workflow execution.

optionProps.name: func
optionProps.title: Function
optionProps.description: JavaScript code to execute. Use 'return msg;' for single output or return an array for multiple outputs. Access variables via global.get(), flow.get(), local.get().

name: Switch
description: Evaluates JavaScript expressions and routes messages to corresponding output ports based on true/false results. Supports break functionality to stop on first match.

optionProps.name: optUseBreak
optionProps.title: Break
optionProps.description: When enabled, stops evaluating remaining conditions after the first true condition is found. All subsequent outputs will be false.

optionProps.name: optConditions
optionProps.title: Output Ports
optionProps.description: JavaScript expressions that evaluate to true or false. Each expression creates an output port. Use msg.property, global.get(), or flow.get() to access data.

name: For Each
description: Iterates through an array, executing the connected workflow for each item. Provides current item and index values for processing.

optionProps.name: optIndex
optionProps.title: Current Index
optionProps.description: Variable name where the current array index (0-based) will be stored in the message during each iteration.

optionProps.name: optInput
optionProps.title: Loop through object
optionProps.description: The array to iterate through. Each element will be processed one at a time in the connected workflow.

optionProps.name: optOutput
optionProps.title: Current Item
optionProps.description: Variable name where the current array item will be stored in the message during each iteration.

name: Break
description: Exits from the current For Each loop immediately, skipping remaining iterations and continuing workflow execution after the loop.

name: Add Item
description: Adds encrypted items to a queue with configurable priority and retry count. Supports both single items and arrays, with AES or RSA encryption.

inputProps.name: inData
inputProps.title: Item
inputProps.description: The object data to add to the queue. Can be a single object or an array of objects. Maximum size is 256KB per item.

inputProps.name: inReference
inputProps.title: Reference
inputProps.description: Optional reference identifier for tracking the item. Used for linking related queue operations.

optionProps.name: optQueueName
optionProps.title: Queue Name
optionProps.description: The name of the queue to add items to. Must be a valid queue identifier.

optionProps.name: optAESKey
optionProps.title: AES Key / RSA Key Pair
optionProps.description: Encryption key from vault for securing queue items. Supports both AES keys for symmetric encryption and RSA key pairs for hybrid encryption.

optionProps.name: optIDKey
optionProps.title: ID Key
optionProps.description: The field name in the item data to use as unique identifier. Used for deduplication and SHA256 hashing of item IDs.

optionProps.name: optPriority
optionProps.title: Priority
optionProps.description: Priority level for queue item processing. Higher priority items are processed first.

optionProps.name: optMaxTry
optionProps.title: Maximum Try Count
optionProps.description: Maximum number of processing attempts for the item before it's marked as abandoned. Must be at least 1.

name: Get Items
description: Retrieves multiple items from a queue based on status and priority filters. Returns decrypted item data with metadata.

inputProps.name: inProgress
inputProps.title: Progress
inputProps.description: Progress identifier to filter items. Used to retrieve items with specific progress states or tracking information.

inputProps.name: inPriority
inputProps.title: Priority
inputProps.description: Filter items by priority level. Select 'All' to retrieve items of any priority, or specific priority levels.

inputProps.name: inStatus
inputProps.title: Status
inputProps.description: Filter items by processing status. Select 'All' to retrieve items regardless of status, or specific statuses like 'New', 'In Progress', etc.

outputProps.name: outItems
outputProps.title: Items
outputProps.description: Array of queue items matching the filter criteria. Each item contains decrypted data, ID, try count, and timestamps.

optionProps.name: optQueueName
optionProps.title: Queue Name
optionProps.description: The name of the queue to retrieve items from. Must match an existing queue identifier.

optionProps.name: optAESKey
optionProps.title: AES Key / RSA Key Pair
optionProps.description: Decryption key from vault for reading encrypted queue items. Must match the encryption method used when items were added.

name: Get Next Item
description: Retrieves the next available item from a queue for processing. Optionally starts a transaction and returns the decrypted item with its ID.

outputProps.name: outID
outputProps.title: Item ID
outputProps.description: Unique identifier of the retrieved queue item. Used for tracking and subsequent operations like updates or deletion.

outputProps.name: outData
outputProps.title: Item
outputProps.description: The decrypted data content of the queue item. Contains the original object that was added to the queue.

optionProps.name: optQueueName
optionProps.title: Queue Name
optionProps.description: The name of the queue to retrieve the next item from. Must be a valid queue identifier.

optionProps.name: optAESKey
optionProps.title: AES Key / RSA Key Pair
optionProps.description: Decryption key from vault for reading the encrypted queue item. Must match the encryption method used when the item was added.

optionProps.name: optStart
optionProps.title: Start Transaction
optionProps.description: Whether to mark the retrieved item as 'in progress'. When true, the item status is updated to prevent other processes from retrieving it.

name: Delete Item
description: Permanently removes an item from the queue using its unique ID. The item will no longer be available for processing.

inputProps.name: inItemID
inputProps.title: Item ID
inputProps.description: The unique identifier of the queue item to delete. This ID is typically obtained from Get Next Item or Get Items operations.

name: Update Item State
description: Updates the status, priority, progress, and retry count of a queue item. Used to mark items as successful, failed, or change their processing priority.

inputProps.name: inProgress
inputProps.title: Progress
inputProps.description: Progress information or status message to associate with the item. Used for tracking processing state.

inputProps.name: inReference
inputProps.title: Reference
inputProps.description: Updated reference identifier for the item. Used for linking related operations or tracking changes.

inputProps.name: inPriority
inputProps.title: Priority
inputProps.description: New priority level for the queue item. Higher priority items are processed first.

inputProps.name: inStatus
inputProps.title: Status
inputProps.description: New processing status for the queue item. Use 'Successful' when processing completed, 'Failed' for errors, or 'Abandoned' to stop retries.

inputProps.name: inAdditionalTry
inputProps.title: Additional Try Count
inputProps.description: Number of additional processing attempts to add to the item's retry count. Extends the maximum try limit.

inputProps.name: inItemID
inputProps.title: Item ID
inputProps.description: The unique identifier of the queue item to update. This ID is typically obtained from Get Next Item or Get Items operations.

name: Wait Item
description: Waits for an item to become available in a queue with configurable timeout and polling intervals. Optionally starts a transaction when an item is retrieved.

inputProps.name: inQueueName
inputProps.title: Queue Name
inputProps.description: The name of the queue to wait for items from. The operation will poll this queue until an item becomes available.

outputProps.name: outID
outputProps.title: Item ID
outputProps.description: Unique identifier of the queue item that became available. Used for tracking and subsequent operations like updates or deletion.

outputProps.name: outData
outputProps.title: Item
outputProps.description: The decrypted data content of the queue item that became available. Contains the original object that was added to the queue.

optionProps.name: optPollTime
optionProps.title: Poll Time (s)
optionProps.description: Interval between queue checks, in seconds. Shorter intervals provide faster response but increase system load. Minimum is 30 seconds.

optionProps.name: optStart
optionProps.title: Start Transaction
optionProps.description: Whether to mark the retrieved item as 'in progress' when found. When true, the item status is updated to prevent other processes from retrieving it.

optionProps.name: optAESKey
optionProps.title: AES Key / RSA Key Pair
optionProps.description: Decryption key from vault for reading encrypted queue items when they become available. Must match the encryption method used when items were added.

optionProps.name: optTimeout
optionProps.title: Timeout (s)
optionProps.description: Maximum time to wait for an item to become available, in seconds. If no item appears within this time, the operation will timeout.

name: Inject
description: Initiates workflow execution by injecting a payload at specified intervals or once. Acts as a starting point for automation flows.

inputProps.name: inPayload
inputProps.title: Payload
inputProps.description: The data to be injected into the workflow. This value will be passed as the initial payload for the automation flow.

outputProps.name: outPayload
outputProps.title: Payload
outputProps.description: The injected payload data that will be passed to the next node in the workflow.

optionProps.name: optRepeat
optionProps.title: Repeat Interval (sec)
optionProps.description: Time interval in seconds between repeated executions. Only applies when 'Once' is disabled. Minimum value is 0.001 seconds.

optionProps.name: optOnce
optionProps.title: Once
optionProps.description: If true, the node executes only once after the specified delay. If false, it repeats at the specified interval.

optionProps.name: optOnceDelay
optionProps.title: Once Delay (sec)
optionProps.description: Initial delay in seconds before the first execution. Used both for single execution and as the first delay for repeated executions. Minimum value is 0.001 seconds.

name: Catch
description: Catches and handles errors from specified nodes in the workflow. Subscribes to error events and triggers when errors occur in monitored nodes.

optionProps.name: optNodes
optionProps.title: Target Nodes
optionProps.description: Configuration for which nodes to monitor for errors. Select specific nodes by ID or choose to catch errors from all nodes in the workflow.

name: Timer
description: Executes workflow based on cron-like scheduling. Triggers at specific times defined by seconds, minutes, hours, days, months, and day of week settings.

inputProps.name: inPayload
inputProps.title: Payload
inputProps.description: The data to be passed through the timer when it triggers. This payload will be forwarded to the next node when the scheduled time is reached.

outputProps.name: outPayload
outputProps.title: Payload
outputProps.description: The payload data that was configured for this timer, passed to the next node when the timer triggers based on the schedule.

optionProps.name: optSecond
optionProps.title: Seconds
optionProps.description: Specific second(s) when the timer should trigger (0-59). Select 'Every Second' to trigger every second, or specific seconds for precise timing.

optionProps.name: optMinute
optionProps.title: Minutes
optionProps.description: Specific minute(s) when the timer should trigger (0-59). Select 'Every Minute' to trigger every minute, or specific minutes for precise timing.

optionProps.name: optHour
optionProps.title: Hours
optionProps.description: Specific hour(s) when the timer should trigger (0-23). Select 'Every Hour' to trigger every hour, or specific hours in 24-hour format.

optionProps.name: optDay
optionProps.title: Day of month
optionProps.description: Specific day(s) of the month when the timer should trigger (1-31). Select 'Every Day of Month' to trigger daily, or specific days.

optionProps.name: optMonth
optionProps.title: Month
optionProps.description: Specific month(s) when the timer should trigger (1-12). Select 'Every Month' to trigger monthly, or specific months.

optionProps.name: optWeekDay
optionProps.title: Day of week
optionProps.description: Specific day(s) of the week when the timer should trigger. Select 'Every Day of Week' to trigger daily, or specific weekdays (Sunday=0 to Saturday=6).

name: Add Item
description: Adds a new item to a vault with specified name and data, returning metadata about the created item.

inputProps.name: inName
inputProps.title: Name
inputProps.description: The name for the new vault item. This will be used as the identifier for the stored data.

inputProps.name: inItem
inputProps.title: Item
inputProps.description: The data object to store in the vault. Can contain credentials, tokens, or any structured data based on the selected category.

outputProps.name: outItem
outputProps.title: Item
outputProps.description: Metadata about the created vault item including name, category, item ID, and vault ID.

optionProps.name: optCategory
optionProps.title: Category
optionProps.description: The category type for the vault item. This determines how the data will be structured and used within the system.

optionProps.name: optVault
optionProps.title: Vault
optionProps.description: The target vault where the item will be stored. Select an existing vault from your vault collection.

name: List Items
description: Lists all items stored in a specified vault, returning their names, vault IDs, and item IDs.

outputProps.name: outItem
outputProps.title: Vault Items
outputProps.description: Array of vault items, each containing name, vault_id, and item_id properties for accessing stored credentials.

optionProps.name: optVault
optionProps.title: Vault
optionProps.description: The vault from which to list all stored items. Select an existing vault to view its contents.

name: Get Item
description: Retrieves stored credentials or data from a specific vault item, returning the decrypted content with metadata.

outputProps.name: outItem
outputProps.title: Item
outputProps.description: The retrieved vault item containing the stored credentials or data along with metadata including vault and item IDs.

optionProps.name: optCredentials
optionProps.title: Credentials
optionProps.description: The specific vault item to retrieve. Select both the vault and the item within that vault to access the stored data.

name: Set Item
description: Updates an existing vault item with new data, replacing the current content while preserving the item's identity.

inputProps.name: inItem
inputProps.title: Item
inputProps.description: The updated data to store in the vault item. This will completely replace the existing content of the selected item.

outputProps.name: outItem
outputProps.title: Item Metadata
outputProps.description: Metadata about the updated vault item including vault and item IDs for confirmation of the operation.

optionProps.name: optCredentials
optionProps.title: Credentials
optionProps.description: The target vault item to update. Select both the vault and the specific item within that vault to modify its stored data.

name: Delete Item
description: Permanently deletes a specific item from a vault, removing all stored data associated with that item.

optionProps.name: optCredentials
optionProps.title: Credentials
optionProps.description: The vault item to delete permanently. Select both the vault and the specific item to be removed from storage.

name: List Vaults
description: Retrieves a list of all available vaults, returning their names and vault IDs for selection in other vault operations.

outputProps.name: outVaults
outputProps.title: Vaults
outputProps.description: Array of available vaults, each containing name and vault_id properties for use in vault operations.

name: WG Create
description: Creates a new wait group for synchronizing multiple concurrent tasks. Returns a unique wait group ID that can be used with other wait group nodes.

outputProps.name: outWaitGroupID
outputProps.title: Wait Group ID
outputProps.description: A unique identifier for the created wait group. Use this ID with WG Add, WG Done, and WG Wait nodes to coordinate task synchronization.

name: WG Add
description: Adds the specified delta count to the wait group counter. Each add operation must be matched with corresponding done operations for the wait group to complete.

inputProps.name: inWaitGroupID
inputProps.title: Wait Group ID
inputProps.description: The unique identifier of the wait group to add tasks to. Must match the ID returned by a WG Create node.

optionProps.name: optDelta
optionProps.title: Delta
optionProps.description: The number of tasks to add to the wait group counter. Must be a positive integer. Each add operation requires a corresponding done operation to complete the wait group.

name: WG Done
description: Marks one task as completed in the wait group by decrementing the counter. When the counter reaches zero, any waiting WG Wait nodes will be released.

inputProps.name: inWaitGroupID
inputProps.title: Wait Group ID
inputProps.description: The unique identifier of the wait group to mark a task as done. Must match the ID returned by a WG Create node.

name: WG Wait
description: Blocks execution until all tasks in the wait group are completed (counter reaches zero). The wait group is automatically cleaned up after completion.

inputProps.name: inWaitGroupID
inputProps.title: Wait Group ID
inputProps.description: The unique identifier of the wait group to wait for completion. Must match the ID returned by a WG Create node.

name: Generate OTP
description: Generates a one-time password for two-factor authentication

outputProps.name: outOTP
outputProps.title: OTP
outputProps.description: Generated one-time password code

optionProps.name: optCredentials
optionProps.title: Secret Key
optionProps.description: TOTP secret key used to generate the OTP

name: Generate QR
description: Generates a QR code for two-factor authentication setup saving it to a specified file path

inputProps.name: inAccountName
inputProps.title: Account Name
inputProps.description: User account name or email for identification

inputProps.name: inIssuer
inputProps.title: Issuer
inputProps.description: Name of the service or application issuing the 2FA

inputProps.name: inQRPath
inputProps.title: QR Code Path
inputProps.description: File path where the QR code image will be saved

outputProps.name: outSecretKey
outputProps.title: Secret Key
outputProps.description: Generated TOTP secret key for authentication

optionProps.name: optPngOrSvg
optionProps.title: Format
optionProps.description: Output format for the QR code image

name: Decode QR
description: Decodes QR codes from image files and extracts the payload useful for 2FA authentication codes and other QR code data

inputProps.name: inQRPath
inputProps.title: QR Code Path
inputProps.description: File path to the QR code image to decode

outputProps.name: outPayload
outputProps.title: Payload
outputProps.description: Decoded content from the QR code

name: Delete Task
description: Deletes a completed or pending ABBYY task

inputProps.name: inTaskID
inputProps.title: Task ID
inputProps.description: ID of the ABBYY task to delete

outputProps.name: outTaskStatus
outputProps.title: Task Status
outputProps.description: Status of the deleted task

name: Get Task Status
description: Retrieves the current status of an ABBYY processing task

inputProps.name: inTaskID
inputProps.title: Task ID
inputProps.description: ID of the ABBYY task to check status

outputProps.name: outTaskStatus
outputProps.title: Task Status
outputProps.description: Current status of the task

name: Process Barcode
description: Processes an image to detect and decode barcodes using ABBYY OCR

inputProps.name: inImagePath
inputProps.title: Image Path
inputProps.description: Path to the image file containing barcodes

outputProps.name: outTask
outputProps.title: Task
outputProps.description: ABBYY task object containing barcode results

optionProps.name: optRegion
optionProps.title: Region
optionProps.description: Region coordinates to scan for barcodes

optionProps.name: optBarcodeType
optionProps.title: Barcode Type
optionProps.description: Type of barcode to detect

optionProps.name: optContainsBinary
optionProps.title: Contains Binary Data
optionProps.description: Whether the barcode contains binary data

optionProps.name: optDescription
optionProps.title: Description
optionProps.description: Description for the processing task

optionProps.name: optPDFPassword
optionProps.title: PDF Password
optionProps.description: Password for encrypted PDF files

name: Process Business Card
description: Processes a business card image to extract contact information using ABBYY OCR

inputProps.name: inImagePath
inputProps.title: Image Path
inputProps.description: Path to the business card image file

outputProps.name: outTask
outputProps.title: Task
outputProps.description: ABBYY task object containing business card results

optionProps.name: optWriteFieldComponents
optionProps.title: Write Field Components
optionProps.description: Include field components

optionProps.name: optCorrectSkew
optionProps.title: Correct Skew
optionProps.description: Auto-correct skew

optionProps.name: optDescription
optionProps.title: Description
optionProps.description: Description for the task

optionProps.name: optExportFormat
optionProps.title: Export Format
optionProps.description: Output format for the results

optionProps.name: optCorrectOrientation
optionProps.title: Correct Orientation
optionProps.description: Auto-correct orientation

optionProps.name: optImageSource
optionProps.title: Image Source
optionProps.description: Source of the image

optionProps.description: Clustering algorithm to use.

optionProps.title: Ordered Keys Only
optionProps.description: Returns keys ordered and sorted by their indices in the input keywords array

optionProps.title: Distance Threshold
optionProps.description: Threshold for clustering. Lower values result in more clusters.

optionProps.name: optNumClusters
optionProps.title: Number of Clusters for K-Means
optionProps.description: Number of clusters for K-Means clustering.

optionProps.title: Epsilon for DBSCAN
optionProps.description: Epsilon parameter for DBSCAN clustering.

inputProps.name: inText
inputProps.title: Text
inputProps.description: Text content to search for keyword occurrences

inputProps.title: Keywords
inputProps.description: Keywords to count in the given text

inputProps.name: inDocs
inputProps.title: Documents
inputProps.description: An array of JSON objects each containing name and text fields. ex: [{"name":"Document 1 name", "text":"Document 1 text}]

optionProps.name: optTopN
optionProps.title: Top N
optionProps.description: Specifies the number of top terms to retrieve from the Frequency analysis.

optionProps.name: optMinNgram
optionProps.title: Min N-gram
optionProps.description: Sets the lower boundary of the range of n-values for different n-gram sizes to be extracted. For instance, min_ngram=1 means the analysis will include unigrams (single words).

optionProps.name: optMaxNgram
optionProps.title: Max N-gram
optionProps.description: Sets the upper boundary for the range of n-values for different n-gram sizes. A max_ngram=3 would mean the analysis includes trigrams (phrases of three words) at most.

optionProps.name: optMinDf
optionProps.title: Min DF
optionProps.description: A value of 0.01 (1%) could be a good starting point. This means ignoring terms that appear in less than 1% of your documents.

optionProps.name: optMaxDf
optionProps.title: Max DF
optionProps.description: A value like 0.5 (50%) can be effective. This filters out terms that appear in more than half of your documents, as they are likely too common to be useful for differentiation.

optionProps.name: optStopWords
optionProps.title: Stop Words Language
optionProps.description: Ignored words during the process of vectorizing text, as these words usually carry less meaningful information for analysis. (ex: the, is, in words in English etc.)

inputProps.name: inSelfKeywordCounts
inputProps.title: Self Keyword Counts
inputProps.description: Keyword frequency in the original text

inputProps.name: inOtherKeywordCounts
